event_name: PRXMTY w/ ASEC, Tommy Four Seven, Blue Hour b2b Newa, LDS, Dold & Hontas
lineup: ROBUS:, ASEC live, Blue Hour b2b Newa, Dold, Hontas, LDS live, Mary Lake, P.E.A.R.L., RUIZ OSC1, Tommy Four Seven, , SUMME:, DHC, Lena Willikens, Sansibar, Viikatory
information:
Sansibar is a distinctive cosmic producer known for transforming intergalactic vibes. As a resident DJ at Kaiku and Post Bar, Sansibar’s genre-defying sound has made a mark with labels like Kalahari Oyster Cult and Natural Sciences, establishing them as a standout talent in the European music scene. Their eclectic style spans across electro, techno, house, and jungle to expansive downtempo soundscapes filled with euphoria and haze. On October 5th, we return with PRXMTY and host Sansibar on the SUMME floor along with DHC, Lena Willikens, and Viikatory while the ROBUS floor sees Tommy Four Seven, RUIZ OSC1, ASEC live, Blue Hour b2b Newa and more.

INFO

• Located on the grounds of the former Bärenquell brewery factory in East Berlin.
• 2 converted Warehouse dancefloors with state of the art sound systems.
• Custom made by Kirsch Audio. 40kW, 48 channels, 153 drivers, signature horn technology
• cash and cashless payment
• 5 min walk from Schöneweide station, 4 stops from Ostkreuz and 3 stops from Neukölln with S-Bahn
• 18 minutes by Bus 165 from Schlesisches Tor

ONLINE PRESALE:

Please anticipate potential delays due to enhanced security checks at the entrance, even for ticket holders. Your cooperation and understanding are greatly appreciated. Thank you.

lineup: Lovebirds , Carlo , Eva Crystaltips , Nephews ,  Luca Olivotto , David Silver , Quadrakey , Marc Brauner , Maltitz , Josiane , Moehecan , Marco Ohboy, DJ whity
information:
Get ready to immerse yourself in the electric vibes of OXI as we return on October 5th for a 20-hour marathon, celebrating the GRAND FINALE of the garden season! After an unforgettable September edition, we're back in full force for October. Prepare to be swept away into a world where the music reigns supreme as we take over OXI’s expansive venue in the heart of Berlin. With one outdoor stage and three indoor floors—including a vinyl-only room—this event promises a one-of-a-kind journey through the very heart of electronic music.

Expect an extraordinary lineup of artists who will craft an atmospheric soundscape, enhanced by OXI’s state-of-the-art sound system and immersive lighting. Whether you're a house enthusiast or a disco lover, the energy of this event is bound to captivate all who live for the pulse of electronic beats.

This isn't just another night out—it's a transformative experience waiting to unfold. Mark your calendars for October 5th and prepare to lose yourself in the rhythm.

Event Details:  
Outdoor: 14:00 - 22:00  
Indoor: 22:00 - 10:00 (next day)  

In House We Trust!   We host DJs all day and night long across four floors (indoor and outdoor). Special Features:  1 Outdoor Floor (wind and rainproof)  3 Indoor Floors  Big chillout area  Food   

IMPORTANT: Reduced Tickets with "entrance before 3 PM" are available online only.   
Tickets with entrance before 3 PM are only valid until 3 PM. After that, you will be charged the difference for the normal ticket price. Thanks for understanding.


OXI features a large outdoor garden and three indoor dance floors. You can find all our vinyl releases, as well as our new release and merch, during the event at OXI! See you there, house music lovers! We strive to provide a safe and worry-free space. Please respect everyone’s identity, act with consent and care. Discriminatory behavior of any kind will not be tolerated. Please respect our no photo/video policy.

event_name: WE WILL DANCE AGAIN - Nova Soli Event
lineup: Sven Weisemann [Mojuba | Freund der Familie, Lux. [IO], John Osborn [DRED Records], Rising Sun [Echochord | Faith Beat], Phonatic [Headroom], Maral Salmassi [Konsequent], Clarisse [Devotion], Matthias Vogt [Polytone Recordings], George P. [Deep Series Recordings], Dj Humus [Jack Off Records], Nico Rosenberg (Live) [INNI], Orik , Rudolph Beuys [Beatrausch], and more TBA
information:
As we approach the anniversary of the massacre of October 7th perpetrated by the terrorist group Hamas in Israel, we invite you to an impressive memorial event for the victims of the Nova Festival, which will take place from 05-06.10.2024 at Club ://about blank. 
At the psytrance festival in the Negev desert alone, roughly 400 young and innocent ravers, who just celebrated life, were brutally murdered. Many more were seriously injured. Hamas kidnapped 40 of them as hostages in the Gaza Strip. There were numerous testimonies of rape and sexual abuse, including gang rape.
One would think that public sympathy and solidarity with the victims would have been heard, especially from the club culture community, which has always prided itself on being ‘one family’, but the reactions were largely, as in the rest of the cultural and artistic landscape, deafening silence or even relativisation and justification of these obvious atrocities.
‘We will dance again’ wants to break this silence and send a strong signal of solidarity and against anti-Semitism, hatred of Israel and the glorification of terror. Because the attack by the Islamist Hamas on the Nova Festival was not just an attack on the visitors to a rave in Israel, but a fundamental attack on the basic values of club culture itself: Love, peace, freedom and unity

The event includes a day and night program with a film screening, panel discussion, reading, dance performance, information stands, Israeli food and a clubnight with DJs and live acts on three floors.

The proceeds will be donated to a foundation that supports the survivors and bereaved of the victims financially and in coping with their trauma.


Timetable:

3pm - 4pm
#NOVA A documentary film by Dan Pe'er

4:30pm - 4:45pm
'Dance in silence'
Dance performance by Adi Amit & Sagi Amir Gros Director & choreography: Sagi Amir Gros

5:15pm - 6pm
Reading with Genia Berg
From her novel 'Last Festival'

6:30pm-7:30pm
Antisemitism in art and culture after october 7th
Panel discussion with
*Jens Balzer – journalist, author of 'After Woke'
*Sharon On - theatre and film director
*Maya Roisman - artist and trainer for political education
*Balbina – musician and creative director at Polyton
*Maral Salmassi – music producer and label operator
*Moderation: Nicholas Potter - Journalist

After panel
An invitation to light a candle in memory of the 404 Nova victims murdered on oct 7th

8pm - 10pm
Music by DJ Rudolph Beuys

From 10:00pm
Clubnight with
Sven Weisemann // Lux. // John Osborn // Rising Sun // Phonatic // Maral Salmassi // Matthias Vogt // Nico Rosenberg (Live) // Clarisse
George P. // Dj Humus // Orik

event_name: QS1 x Renate with Beatrice, Janzon, Mascha, DJ Speed x DJ Frequency, Sparkling Water Dreams
lineup: BLACK ROOM, , AOIFE x Beatrice (DE) , Chaz Moloney (Live), Janzon , Mascha , , GREEN ROOM, , DJ Speed x DJ Frequency "The Loopmasters", Kedi Bounce [QS1], Serving Suggestions , , RED ROOM, , Sparkling Water Dreams [QS1] , DJ Zurückbleiben Bitte x Paul Munz
information:
October 5th QS1 are back at Renate 

In classic QS1 Fashion we have some new heads joining us, along with our long time friends and Residents. Almost to the day one year ago, we got the chance to host our first takeover in Renate, and it kicked off a whole series of events which we had never seen coming. Opening the doors to a Venue that fits thousands of people, felt truly nerve wracking, but exciting and like a step we wanted to take. 

This chapter to our Renate story will also be our last as a full full venue take over. These takeovers have given us the chance to invite friends to the stage and give the platform to people who we feel have really earned it. Thanks to all included once again for the unwavering support, assistance and love. You know who you are <3

This time is no different:

Delivering Tunes on Saturday 5th will be:

Aoife x Beatrice
Chaz Moloney
DJ Speed x DJ Frequency
DJ Zurückbleiben Bitte x Paul Munz
Janzon
Kedi Bounce
Mascha
Serving Suggestions
Sparkling Water Dreams

See you on the dancefloor 


Born from an unrenovated apartment building in Friedrichshain, across the river from Treptower Park, Renate has three main dance floors and many smaller rooms to explore. Every shade and subgenre of electronic music has its place here, from fast, groovy techno to uplifting house music, from chugging EBM to frenetic breakbeat stompers.

☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐ ☐

information:
Dear dreamers*,

We haven’t talked about our crazy dreams in a while now, but we kept our whiskers on whispers for a good reason: we were plotting in secrecy.  

And nope, this event is not AI generated to fit your algorithm - it’s actually true!  We’re giggling over cat jokes here at Rebellion HQ looking for the perfect metapurr for this occasion!

✶ 𝟏𝟏 𝐘𝐄𝐀𝐑𝐒 𝐎𝐅 𝐑𝐄𝐁𝐄𝐋𝐋𝐈𝐎𝐍 𝐃𝐄𝐑 𝐓𝐑𝐀̈𝐔𝐌𝐄𝐑* 𝐀𝐓 𝐊𝐀𝐓𝐄𝐑 𝐁𝐋𝐀𝐔   ✶

Cat class and cat style, and we can’t wait to chase some lasers with you. 

So lets clean our tuna cans and get into our fanciest leo pattern - we brought the best catnip against any Katzenjammer:

It's gonna be really pawesome!

_____________________

information:
Der Schwede Alexander Berg etablierte sich zu Beginn des letzten Jahrzehnts zunächst als Teil des Duos Genius of Time und später als Solokünstler unter dem Namen Dorisburg mit einem präzisen, hypnotischen Tech-House-Sound. Nachdem er und sein Label Aniara 2023 aus einem vierjährigen Winterschlaf erwacht sind, ist er wieder so alert und präsent wie eh und je – nach dem frei fließenden Ambient-Album That Who Remembers, das er zusammen mit Sebastian Mullaert für Spazio Disponibile aufgenommen hat, veröffentlicht er auch wieder seine ausgedehnten, höhlenartigen Dancefloor-Grooves mit glitzernden Melodien. Dorisburg spielt live in der Säule zur heutigen Klubnacht. Ebenfalls live präsentiert der Portugiese Nørbak seine Musik im Berghain – nach Releases auf Axis, Hayes und Mord debütiert er in diesem Jahr mit einer starken 4-Track-EP auf Token, auf der er eine perfekte Balance zwischen Rauheit und technischer Tiefe und Finesse hält. Freuen kann man sich auch auf ein DJ-Set des kalifornischen Techno-Produzenten Developer, der nach einem fünfjährigen Hiatus wieder im Berghain auflegt.

Hailing from Sweden, Alexander Berg first made a splash a decade and a half ago first as half the duo Genius of Time, then as a solo artist under the name Dorisburg, pushing a precise, hypnotic tech-house sound. Now that he and his label Aniara came out of a four-year hibernation, he is as alert and present as ever – after recording the free-flowing ambient album That Who Remembers with Sebastian Mullaert for Spazio Disponibile, he's now back to releasing his sprawling, cavernous dancefloor grooves with glittering melodies. Dorisburg will be playing live in Säule for this edition of Klubnacht. On the Berghain floor, also presenting his music live is Portugal's Nørbak – after releases on Axis, Hayes and Mord, he linked up with Token this year for a strong 4-track EP, striking the perfect balance between rawness and technical depth and finesse. You can also look forward to a DJ set by Californian techno producer Developer, back at Berghain after a five-year hiatus.

promoters: Badehaus Szimpla, xcuse:u, Badehaus Musik GmbH
lineup: sleeptwitch (xcuse:u), ayu bi (xcuse:u), elliephunk (casadephunk) , Vanessa Vegas (xcuse:u alumini)
information:
xcuse:u takes over House of Bade at Badehaus, bringing along a stellar lineup to fill the night with eclectic sounds and community vibes.

This night is going to be special, filled with colorfully curated tunes, dancefloor liberation, and an incredible sense of community.

At House of Bade, we do not tolerate any form of discrimination—whether it's racism, sexism, queerphobia, or any toxic behavior. We’re dedicated to creating a safer space for all. If you feel uncomfortable or need help, our team and venue staff are always available.

More about the line-up:

The Berlin DJ and culture collective xcuse:u e.V. was founded in June 2022 by Ele, Kiki, Freya and Chiara with the help of a grant from Popkultur Lokal. The aim of the collective is to take progressive steps towards an inclusive club culture. With their events dedicated to the political aspects of club culture - such as representation, empowerment, safer spaces and raising awareness of discrimination - they want to create community spaces where people can inform themselves and raise awareness through workshops on (queer) feminist topics. xcuse:u wants to show that it is possible to make club nights safer, more non-discriminatory and more supportive. The representation of FLINTA* artists is clearly in the foreground - but the events are open to all supporters.



ayu bi always aims to abandon genres and borders, far away from a musical binary
they are weaving sounds from ear, to hips, to feet and through ur eyes - into a state of increased awareness for our surroundings, our fellow humans and the fibers of our interconnections.
music in its vibrant, lustrous diversity is meant to be celebrated.
life is too short for borders in the present,
let us tear down these limiting beliefs all together.
in ecstasy we free ourselves and on the dance floor,
we unite body, mind and collective purpose.


Sleeptwitch is one for the nerds: bringing the oldschool sounds to life with a focus on electro, detroit sounds and dreamy robotic music. This time they prepared a special mixture from acid house, to fun classics and everything in between.
Actively engaged in Berlin's music scene, she hosts two ongoing radio shows at Cashmere Radio and Systems Radio and is part of two collectives (@xcuseu.kollektiv @crush.kollektiv), organizing female and queer focused events, workshops, DJ sessions, and much more.

elliephunk is an avid SoundCloud surfer, old-time CD collector, and Berlin based, Taiwanese-American artist who has an unwavering passion for community building, and curating soundscapes that move the soul. Her sets are often lined with a groovy, punchy bass, and her body-moving selects generally pull from a housey mix of minimal bounce, handbag vocals, jazzy instrumentals, rhythmic beats, and UKG breaks... she’s also known for sprinkling in '80s soul, and nostalgic ’90s RnB/hip-hop samples for extra flavor.
Beyond the decks: As founder, catalyst, and “main mamacita” at casadephunk (a.k.a. casa), she’s taking an offbeat approach to event curation and shaping a new community around the concept “casa = house = home”. Bouncing between cozy, elevated in-house programs, and thoughtfully cute club nights, casa’s events bring together a diverse mix of artists from a wide range of disciplines: from visual to design, to fashion, to live music, to DJs and producers from various experience levels.

Vannessa Vegas, French born and Berlin-based, Sophie, aka Vanessa Vegas, has always had a deep connection to music. Her passion began on the dance floors, where countless hours spent immersing herself in the beats shaped her musical identity.
Having made her debut behind the decks during xcuse:u’s last DJ workshop, she brings a sweet tooth for 90s house, vocals, and high-energy grooves.

event_name: Rhythm Section Berlin: Bradley Zero, Elias Mazian, JADA, MLE
lineup: Bradley Zero Elias Mazian JADA MLE (UK)
information:
Berlin! We're returning to Ohm with some old and new friends for a good ole' RS dance going all night long. 

We'll be joined by Amsterdam based DJ and producer Elias Mazian, a firm fixture of the club circuit in Amsterdam and beyond His DJ sets are never predictable, with house music forming a base to deviate from into all manner of unexpected sounds, be it jungle, techno or a classic pop song. The former Trouw and De School resident is refreshingly unafraid to share his sensitive side on the emotional journeys that form his dj sets, productions and radio shows. 

Also joining us is JADA a multidisciplinary artist known for her vibrant selection. Her characteristically joyful sets consist of catchy grooves and soulful nuances between house, breakbeat and bass music. Blending r&b, rap, baile funk and afro influences in-between she dives into the spectrum of sub-genres and conceptualises new soundscapes - the intersection of progressive dance music.

These two great DJ'S will be sandwiched between RS residents MLE and BZ who always put on a great show.


SEE YOU IN THE DANCE!
TWO RULES
1. Be nice
2. No photos on the dance floor plz... (take them outside before u get in )
----> BRING PHOTO ID! <--

event_name: Molly Nilsson 'Un-American Activities' Record Release Show
lineup: Molly Nilsson, Apostille
information:
On Oct 5th at 90mil, Shameless/Limitless proudly presents the record release show for Molly Nilsson’s 11th studio album, "Un-American Activities” (Dark Skies Association / Night School), a conceptual work written and recorded in Los Angeles in spring 2024, and a project in support of which which only a very limited number of shows will be played.

Support comes via the Glasgow based Night School Records recording artist and longtime partner in Un-American Activities and beyond, Apostille.

—
In Molly Nilsson’s words:

These songs were recorded during the first quarter of 2024 as part of the Villa Aurora residency program held at the former home of Lion and Marta Feuchtwanger (née Löffler) in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles.

Lion Feuchtwanger, born July 7, 1884, was a German Jewish novelist and playwright. Born into an affluent family – his father owned a margarine factory in Munich – Feuchtwanger was the oldest of nine siblings, two of whom also became authors. An early and outspoken opponent of the National Socialists, Feuchtwanger was among the first to be declared an official enemy of the state in Germany. His books were subsequently burnt, and his citizenship revoked.

In 1933, the now stateless Feuchtwanger sought safety in France. There, however, he would be imprisoned twice. First with the declaration of war in 1939, and again in 1940 after Hitler invaded France. With the SS drawing closer, Feuchtwanger managed to escape captivity following the intervention of, among others, First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt. A long-time reader who happened to recognise his face in a photo of work camp inmates, Roosevelt helped to facilitate his treacherous escape from Europe. Arriving in Portugal via Spain, he boarded a ship bound for America: the Excalibur. Travelling with a false passport under the name “Wetcheeks,” the literal English translation of his name, Feuchtwanger crossed the Atlantic. He arrived in America in 1941.

The Feuchtwangers eventually settled in the outskirts of Los Angeles, purchasing their home for $9,000, equivalent to the annual salary of a teacher at that time. From 1943, he continued to work and write alongside famous, LA-based exiles like Bertolt Brecht and Thomas Mann. Both were close friends and frequent house guests – though never both at the same time. He and his wife Marta established themselves in their villa, which became a meeting point, literary salon, and a bastion for anti-fascists and leftist intellectuals on the West Coast.

As World War II ended and the Cold War began, wartime allies became new enemies. In the McCarthy era “Red Scare” that ensued, suspicion of leftists turned into hatred. Thousands of real or suspected communists were persecuted in a series of public hearings held by the Committee of Un-American Activities. Many of those called as witnesses were humiliated, defamed, and blacklisted as a result. Countless lives and careers were destroyed by these hearings, and many suicides followed in their wake. Bertolt Brecht left America the day after taking the witness stand, never to return. Lion Feuchtwanger never had to face the committee, but his association with and open sympathy for the USSR prevented him from obtaining American citizenship, and thereby a passport with which to travel.

Lion Feuchtwanger died in 1956 after fifteen years in the USA. He was still stateless at the time of his death. Marta continued to live in the villa until her passing in 1986, leaving the estate and its immense library, which included more than 20,000 volumes, to USC. The property was eventually sold to the German state, which it now uses to host artist residencies, with several fellowships in various artistic fields provided each year.

This record commemorates the 140th birthday of Lion Feuchtwanger.

—

This event will take place at 90mil, a non-profit, DIY space near Jannowitzbrücke, Berlin. Entrance is via suggested donation at the door only. You must be a member to enter. You can become a member by purchasing a membership card at the door for €5. This card is valid for a year. See less

information:
It’s been one hell of a HOT ASS SUMMER 
But as the nights draw in and the days get shorter, your favourite BASSment rumbles in anticipation and itching underneath the Straße of Mehringdamm are the bass junkies, sound nerds and sub headed freaks….and they’re raring to go! 

We’ve had a cheeky little summer break (hard and fast as it may have been) but we are BACK and ready to serve you up your next dose of DnB Served to you by some of the industry’s sexiest, sassiest and fiercest FLINTA’s….lets get pumped for FACILITATE. 

Join us for part 3 of our underground FLINTA DnB party where we welcome Berlin and Paris QUEEN SoyKlō and Balkan Baddie Souci !
You will also be kindly hosted by FACILITATE. Mamas DJ Flounce and DJ NORTHERN.

Put it in your diary, click attending and let’s fill that tiny bassment with a bunch of Bass lovin‘ cuties !!! 

We are a femmes to the front and queer safe event space where we firmly believe in consideration to the space we take up on the dance floor. Privilege to be acknowledged. Care and kindness to be given. Moments to be shared.
Mosh pit bros to the back. You are welcome here but take note of the above! 

Any kind of sexism, racism, homophobia, transphobia, discrimination, aggressive or predatory behaviour won’t be tolerated. We want to create a safe space where people can feel love, be free and feel safe.

Can’t wait to see you all there!
Much love, 
Your FACILITATE. gals xox

event_name: Apéro Club XL Vol.2 - Pillow Princess X What A Playground
lineup: Aleks BLC , Kidcat & ilbroccolovolante , Lena Brecht b2b LeVe , MI$ JUNIA
information:
Back for round two, Apéro Club XL

The match made in heaven is matching again. Pillow Princess and What a Playground are once again teaming up bringing all the housey sounds that keep us moving. Together, we’re crafting another 12+ hour journey of music, community, and love at Crack Bellmer including a lovely guest from Copenhagen, one of our Berlin favourites and three hours of open decks to support fresh talent. 

From the soft glow of the aperitif to the pulse of the dance floor, we’ll guide you from happy hour to after hour, with nothing but good vibes and a place for everybody. 

 

Like during our first edition we‘ll start early with three slots of open decks to provide space DJs to play first sets within a club setting. To apply for one of the slots please use the link in @pillow.princess.berlin & @what_a_playground bios and highlights.

At the door, we’ll be collecting donations to support @kop_berlin which stands for "Kampagne für Opfer rassistisch motivierter Polizeigewalt”. This campaign works to support and advocate for individuals who have experienced racial profiling, discrimination, and violence at the hands of the police, raising awareness about systemic racism within law enforcement. Let's dance with purpose and come together to make a difference ♡

Your Pillow Princess & What a Playground crews

bring a friend, not an attitude.
doors: free entry until 10pm and flexi after.

lineup: Love Leya, Dom Hyuga , Will Tran, C3MSTA, Rapha Garcés
information:
Welcome to the newest and best project of the Berlin house music scene:
Pomelo Members Club
October 5, 2024 / 11PM-Late
@marmor_bar

DJs:

We are thrilled to have Dom Hyuga (@yami_club), one of Berlin’s hottest house DJs ( only god knows what’s in his small bag he’s always with ) spinning his signature beats. Known for headlining the capital’s best parties, Dom’s electrifying sets are guaranteed to keep you moving.

Love Leya, the rising star from Frankfurt, is taking the scene by storm. Since being booked by @keinemusikcrue for the exclusive Audemars Piguet event in Switzerland, her career is set to soar to new heights! See u soon Leya.

Will Tran, a Vietnamese-American artist who crafts sets that seamlessly merge cultural influences with pulsating beats. Recognizable by an iconic pink telephone, Will has graced the decks at Soho House Berlin and Georgia Bar, while also completing a two-month tour across Vietnam.

Rapha Garcés is an Ecuadorian DJ who now lives in Berlin. You can only love this positively crazy man.
He regularly enlivens the crowd with his Latin house mixed with minimal beats. He used to play at the best clubs. I don’t know what we love more his hair or his music.
We are very happy to have you with us Rapha.

C3MSTA started DJing less than a year ago and has managed to inspire people in Europe with his music in such a short time. Wait and see what the guy with the Colgate smile has prepared for you.

Location:

Marmor bar is located in the heart of Berlin’s electronic music scene. High class sound system meets aesthetic flair, good atmosphere and perfect drinks. What else do you need?

Please Note:

Due to the huge demand we had to turn away several hundred people at the last events. Please come early to increase your chances of getting in. Please don’t push at the door and take care of each other.

Even the organizers cannot place themselves above the security policy of the city of Berlin, please respect that.

Entrance fee is cash only

lineup: Smoothie Operator, Flink&Willig, Erosiv
information:
Da die Open-Air Saison auf dem Teufelsberg mit euch durchweg ein wahres Fest war, dürfen wir noch eine letzte herbstliche Zugabe spielen.

Am Samstag sehen wir uns noch ein mal auf dem Beatgarten-Dancefloor und können zusammen tanzend die letzten warmen Sonnenstrahlen genießen.

Freut Euch auf wundervolle Menschen, eine einzigartige Location und feinste DJs. Tickets gibt es ausschließlich vor Ort. 
Für Verpflegung ist gesorgt, genauso für Awareness. Ihr könnt Euch jeder Zeit bei unserem Awarenessteam, den Kollektivmitgliedern oder der Teufelsberg-Crew melden! Unser Floor ist barrierefrei zugänglich.   

Unsere Kapazitäten/Tickets sind begrenzt, daher können wir eventuelle Wartezeiten nicht vermeiden und den Einlass leider nicht garantieren. Um Enttäuschungen zu vermeiden: Come early! :)   

Wir freuen uns auf Euch! ♡

event_name: MYSTIC CREATURES x BAHNWÄRTER THIEL w. Wanda Wild, Moritz Butschek, F.I.E.L.D.Y., Jawwa
lineup: Wanda Wild , [Bahnwärter Thiel / Villa Tu Nicht Gut], , Moritz Butschek , [Bahnwärter Thiel / Two In A Row], , F.I.E.L.D.Y, [Bahnwärter Thiel / Ritter Butzke], , Jawwa , [Bahnwärter Thiel / Lugila], , Faulchen Fänther
information:
Die Mystic Creatures haben sich in 2024 nochmal tiefer mit dem Bahnwärter Thiel verbandelt. Der Kunst & Kulturort aus München besteht seit 2015 und will "einen Beitrag zur Formung einer reflektierten, respektvollen und weitsichtigen Gesellschaft" liefern. "Ein Ort für Begegnungen auf Augenhöhe, bei dem der Phantasie keine Schranken gesetzt sind."
Wir freuen uns sehr diese beiden Crews bei uns auf dem Dach zu haben – vom Nachmittag in die Nacht, mit wunderbarer elektronischer Musik, Austausch und wilder Feierei.

[EN]
This year the Mystic Creatures crew spun closer bonds with the Munich based Art- & Culturespace Bahnwärter Thiel. Since 2015 Banhwärter Thiel is a project offering Urban Gardening, studios, ateliers, a youth-club, a bistro and various cultural events like clubnights, concerts and much more at their big venue located right next to the railroad tracks. We are very happy to host these amazing crews together – for a special edition of "Mystic Tales above the clouds".

Just be you, your BU.

event_name: Kiezsalon with Anna Mieke, Muireann Bradley and Conor
lineup: Anna Mieke, Muireann Bradley , Conor
information:
This weekend edition of Kiezsalon returns to our familiar stomping grounds, the Musikbrauerei. Following Friday’s lineup of Svitlana Nianio, Romarna Campbell and Atsuko Hatano, it continues Saturday with a focus on Irish music. Traversing the nation’s diverse artistic landscape, we will present dreamy folk musician Anna Mieke, blues revivalist Muireann Bradley making her Berlin debut, electronic music newcomer producer Conor and Gash Collective founder and DJ ELLLL.

Originally from Wicklow, Ireland, Anna Mieke is a vocalist and multi-instrumentalist whose lyricism and enveloping compositions straddle the line between folk forms and vivid dreamscapes, drawing on traditional and contemporary motifs. The duality of reality and romanticism forms the thematic core of Theatre, her second album issued by Nettwerk in 2022 that “mines a rich seam of nostalgia and loss – and her extensive travels” as The Guardian summarised in their four-star review of the record.

Muireann Bradley is a 17-year-old fingerpicking guitarist and singer from County Donegal, Ireland, specialising in country, ragtime, and Piedmont blues from the 1920s and 1930s. During the 2020 lockdowns, she began uploading videos to YouTube and quickly gained attention with her rendition of Blind Blake’s “Police Dog Blues”, leading to an album offer from Tompkins Square. Her album I Kept These Old Blues was released in late 2023, featuring live studio recordings that echo the classic country blues artists of the early 20th century. The Irish Times gave the “impressive and hugely promising” debut four stars.

In his latest musical endeavour, Berlin-based Irish artist Conor is driven by an exploration of dancefloor sounds that juxtapose functionality and abstraction. From ambient and downtempo to industrial and glitch, his eclectic taste converges into a singular, forward-thinking sound that defies easy categorisation. With the premiere of his live set, Conor is also celebrating the upcoming release of his debut album on Digital in Berlin.

We are always happy to be back at the 120-year-old building of the Musikbrauerei in Prenzlauer Berg. Tucked away between Greifswalder Straße and Volkspark Friedrichshain, the former Schneider brewery is a rare building in former East Berlin for having survived, unspoiled, the creeping tide of gentrification. As we usually sell out, we recommend booking tickets in advance.

lineup: Fluffy Maybes, Pretty Average, Bed
information:
Pretty Average invited the bands Bed and Fluffy Maybes to accompany them in their September tour stop in Berlin to complete a sonic experience that we won't forget.

Pretty Average strives to bring a fresh musical perspective to Berlin, that of a frontwoman who sets out to make a difference with her songwriting. Candy sings her songs in a gender-indistinct manner, backed by the distortion and the raw sound that Sergi has been developing since relocating to Berlin himself. They haven't stopped working on their music ever since. They intend to develop musically to help establish a musical counter-culture that resists today’s nihilism. A value that has been part of the band's identity since its beginning in late 2021.Last year Francisco Parisi produced the band for their latest release “All I wanted”, they published two editions of vinyl run, the first edition being sold out. Currently organising to keep working on singles with him until next year.

BED is a Berlin based band founded by Argentinian bass player Sol Astolfi and Chilean vocalist Nicolás Astorga in 2021. After initial experimentation and writing sessions, they invited German guitarist Ema Schiller to join. After the recording sessions for their first album, Turkish musician Eylul Deniz joined the ensemble. At its core, BED is a queer musical project, with a sound rooted in shoegaze, dream pop and post punk. Their lyrics are sad and sexual, weaving together threads of both vulnerability and desire, producing a body of work that challenges normative creative expression. This is exemplified in the vocalizations, which are intentionally gender ambiguous, representing a fluid identity throughout the album. Inspired by musicians such as Liz Harris (Grouper), Kevin Shields (My Bloody Valentine), Elizabeth Fraser (Cocteau Twins), Courtney Love (Hole) and Bowery Electric, the band winds together iconic elements of the 90s scene, layered with ambient and influenced by the Berlin rave scene. On the upcoming release, BED collaborated with electronic music producer Cybermission, who contributed drums and synth on the first single. EVERYTHING HURTS, the introductory track to the intimate glistening universe of BED is an angelic cry for help: a swan song to save a breaking relationship or to repair a broken heart.

Fluffy Maybes 松软许诺 is a kind of soft promise that may not be kept, a transcontinental musical experiment birthed in the pandemic. Finally meeting in person and under unexpected quarantine conditions, Jingyun and Robin recorded six hours of improvised sessions which eventually formed the single ‘Unnatural Disaster’ and the forthcoming EP. Moving through sounds of early electronica, sun-drenched psychedelia, and floating ambience, Fluffy Maybes 松软许诺 generate moments of spontaneous sonic playfulness, hypnotic pulses from other worlds and evolving waves of nature-inspired synthesis. Whatever happens in the future, at least for now we can shower you with some fluffy maybes.

lineup: @DJ DOODSLAG, @lonalih
information:
The demo station by Rirkrit Tiravanija is a stage-like sculpture that invites people to “demonstrate” something. Tiravanija plays with the different meanings of the term “demonstration” as both a political protest and a presentation of someone’s talent or hobby. For the duration of the exhibition, the demo station provides a space for daily public performances.
The demo station is activated daily (except on the closing day on Tuesday) between 15:00 and 17:00 with various events. From DJ sets and concerts to workshops and readings, the varied programme invites you to watch, listen or participate. The demo station is located in the atrium of the Gropius Bau, the events are free of charge and accessible without a ticket to the exhibition.
During the event, photographs and video recordings may be made in which you may be recognisable. By attending, you consent to these recordings being used to communicate the event or exhibition.

lineup: FUJI​|​|​|​|​|​||​|​|​|​|​TA (live), Margaux (live)
information:
FUJI||||||||||TA is a Sound Artist and composer based in Japan. He creates his unique sound art and music which takes various natural phenomena that respond to his interest in wanting to hear unheard sounds and noises. In 2009 Fujita hand fabricated an original instrument, a Pipe Organ. Since then, he has released a number of different sets, but what he have in common is that his expressions are mainly use the sounds of air and minimal. 
This year he released his new album “MMM” on Hallow Ground.

~

As a sound artist, Margaux Gazur explores possibilities of sounds, using unconventional instruments, everyday objects and field recording to create a rich and textured soundscape. She studied classical piano at the Conservatoire. Over time, she became increasingly interested in the possibilities of unconventional sound sources and started to incorporate these into her compositions. Using everyday objects and sounds from surrounding environments allow her to create music that is both deeply personal and universally resonant.

information:
To be asked WHERE WERE YOU?
and you can answer I WAS THERE
on Sunday, October 6 at @mena.berlin starting at 7p.m.
A Ron Hardy documentary fundraiser party

There is a legend of a night between 1982 and 1987, at the Music Box in Chicago, when Ron Hardy left a mix running while the dance floor was still vibrating to the music. The booth seemed empty, but the music wouldn’t stop, creating a surreal and magical atmosphere. Attendees say that, although no one could see Ron Hardy, they felt his presence through the music, as if he was controlling the energy of the party in an almost mystical way.

We invite you to relive that experience. Feel free to explore the space, what do you hear? Feel the power of music propelling your body to explore by dancing. Imagine that you were there, that it is now, a temporary space that repeats itself while the experience is new and yet not. Those sounds are familiar, they are the legacy Ron left to our constant attempts to build community around the groove, and protest by dancing, because we exist and resist.

*Come and support with whatever you can this documentary about Ron Hardy’s life, because oral history is lost and we can’t afford it. #pleasedonate

Thanks to all the DJs who, with their music and love for House music, will help give Ronnie the place he deserves.

- - - - - 

From @OtherstotheFront we call on all creatures saved by the feeling of House music to donate and give support to @iwastheredoc - a documentary about the Life of Ron Hardy, which is also the history of House and at the same time our history.

Resident of the “Muzic Box” - an inclusive space where different realities converged: Black, Latinxs, LGBTQ+ people, and music lovers from various walks of life - Ron Hardy was always keeping this atmosphere alive, reflecting a club culture geared towards freedom, escape, and self-expression.

We always have loved that Hardy was not afraid to break the rules and experiment with new sounds. He understood the power of music as a force to bring people together, and his ability to mix genres and styles contributed to that diversity on the dance floor. Through his music, Hardy created an environment where social and cultural barriers dissolved on the dance floor.

Nothing would be the same without Hardy, this is why we are here talking about Ronnie now.

Let’s give him the place he deserves in (our) history. We owe it to Ron, and to future generations to keep his story alive. #pleasedonate make it happen! #savethedates
6.OCT @mena.berlin
24.OCT @fitzroyclub
#staytuned more updates coming soon!

"The money raised  from the event will go towards an interview shoot in Chicago in November with Robert Williams - the man responsible for giving Ron Hardy and Frankie Knuckles there starts, as the founder of The Muzic Box and The Warehouse."

lineup: tba
Visage, Queenie Starr, Martini Cherry Furter, The Incredible, Edible, Akynos with Angel Maxine, Michelle Tshibo, Jade Lee, Exocee and Savannah Morgan, Liquid Brain Orchestra
information:
Little Woman, BIG HAIR Presents: Black H'or Futurism

An Immersive Theatrical Experience Inspired by Octavia Butler's "Parable of the Sower"

Berlin, Germany – August 6, 2024 – Little Woman, BIG HAIR Productions is thrilled to continue their collaboration with The Black Sex Worker Collective (BSWC) in the 2024 theme for the ongoing performance and storytelling series Heaux Tales with the latest socially engaged theatrical performance project theme: Black H'or Futurism. Part of the ongoing campaign for visibility, inclusion, the DEcriminalization of bodies and financial stability for The Black Sex Worker Collective - Berlin, this year’s theme is loosely inspired by Octavia Butler's speculative fiction novel "Parable of the Sower." 
Black H'or Futurism is a groundbreaking performance that delves into the sexual creative energies of Black Sex Workers in the fight for environmental justice, land rights, and labor rights with the backdrop of technology. In fragments, this production encourages the reimagining and reclamation of the displaced bodies and minds of those forced to the margins by social inequalities.
In over 24 hours of interdisciplinary and intersectional artistry, attendees enter the irresistible imagination of the central operating mind of a sleeping Black Sex Worker, portrayed by artist MF Akynos. Where in her dreamscape, a world unfolds fragmented dreams and false awakenings that explore the morbid realities, joy, and resilience within queer and migrant communities. Here, we find our roots in Afro futurism and African parables. Where our perception of darkness is challenged, the ancestors come to life, technology has greatly advanced, and onlookers access the transformative idea that sex work is part of our human future and that theories and practices of sex work developed by Sex Workers are essential in melding technologies, global Black experiences, and paths for radical tomorrows. 
Black H’or Futurism is profane, dirty, transgressive, posits future worlds built by and reflecting the experiences of people of African descent. Excerpts of the show will incorporate music, rest & rehabilitation and food. Commencing on October 6 through 7, the experience takes place at Berlin's own transformative artistic space, 90 Mil. A bevy of surprise guest artists will interpolate intersectional art within the conceptual dreamscape of creator and BSWC executive director, The Incredible, Edible, Akynos. Alongside original performances and stories by BSWC-Berlin members: Queenie Starr, Visage, and Angel Maxine. With guest performances by Liquid Brain Orchestra, Exocee, Savannah Morgan, Jade Lee, Michelle Tshibo, Mia on Acid, Edie Montana, and more!

Advanced ticket purchasing is highly encouraged. Those who cannot attend in person are welcomed to purchase tickets for communities who otherwise cannot afford to attend. Sales go towards the ongoing project creation which directly supports people of multiple marginalized backgrounds.

Intimität braucht Raum und Zeit zum Teilen – wenn wir Sonntags unsere Teppiche im Beate Uwe ausbreiten, dann kreieren wir den Raum und die Zeit, zusammen das Erlebte noch einmal in Zärtlichkeit auszutauschen. Die schnelllebige Nacht birgt viele Erinnerungen – auf weichen Füßen wollen wir diese noch einmal in unsere Mitte bringen.

Beate Barfuß: Ruheraum.

Martin Henning

Jacob Groening

Huxby

slægi

---------------------------------

△ Nur Abendkasse.

△ Jeder Mensch ist bei Beate Uwe willkommen und soll sich wohl und sicher fühlen! Das heißt: jegliche Art von Rassismus, Sexissmus, Antisemitismus, Queer-phobie, Ableismus oder sonstige Formen von Diskriminierung werden absolut nicht toleriert.

△ Du hast etwas verloren oder vergessen? Komm Fr-So zu einer unserer Veranstaltungen vorbei und frag an der Kasse oder schicke uns eine Mail an lostandfound@beate-uwe.de.

Intimacy needs space and time to share – when we spread out our carpets at Beate Uwe on Sundays, we create the space and time to gently exchange our experiences together once again. The fast-paced night holds many memories – on soft feet, we want to bring them back into our midst once more.

lineup: Hannes Kretzer - Triloka - The Four - Raz O'Hara & Lihli - Andromeda Mega Express Orchestra - Primeiro
information:
SANCTUM OF SOUND IS A MUSICAL FORUM FOR LISTENERS OF SACRED SOUND IN MAHALLA.

Curated and produced by the MaHalla team every first sunday of the month Sanctum of Sound will transform MaHalla for 12 hours from 12pm to 12am into a sacred space that is worshipping the creation and transmission of music and sound.

HANNES KRETZER
12PM – 2PM

Hannes Kretzer presents an immersive ambient sound experience, utilizing a quadrophonic setup to immerse the audience in spatial layers of textured sound. The performance will feature new material alongside previously released compositions, weaving together the resonant tones of the Cristal Baschet—an instrument known for its haunting, otherworldly resonance—and the deep, immersive vibrations of custom-built gong resonator speakers. This rich and dynamic sonic environment blurs the line between the organic and the electronic, guiding listeners into a reflective and meditative state.

TRILOKA
2PM – 4PM

TRILOKA offers an augmented sonic experience through the interaction of live acoustic and electronic instruments for meditative explorations, silent contemplation and the unfolding of the body-mind in the form of extended ambient sound journeys.The intercultural trio guides an immersive and introspective journey by combining the soothing melodies of the acoustic cello, the contemporary and psychedelic sound sculptures of the effected and processed electric guitar and the grounding frequencies of the gong and singing bowls.All of that while you comfortably sit or lay down, close your eyes, meditate, dream along or float away in the amazing space of MaHalla.

THE FOUR
4PM – 6PM

For each Sanctum of Sound, the music Ashram puts together a 4-piece formation of guest musicians and members of the Ashram.

RAZ O’HARA & LIHLA
6PM – 8PM

Rich and diverse in its sonic palette, Raz Ohara’s music shifts from soothing ambient textures, and harshly distorted synth peaks, to cinematic soundscapes interwoven with avant-garde contemporary classical and jazz music. His unique vocal style is imbued with a soulful and beautiful strangeness, an ability to convey deep lyrics of love, loss, introspection and exploration of emotional and spiritual themes.Classically trained cellist, composer and storyteller Lihla (Lih Qun Wong) combines a vast instrumental skillset of piano, cello, electronics and spoken word, to craft intensely immersive aural-hallucinatory worlds of intricately shifting landscapes. Classical instruments capture the meeting place between memory and longing, while explorational vocal and cello styles invoke and echo the ancient, the feminine, and the otherworldly.In their new collaboration, “An offering” dreamlike cinematic instrumental and electronic soundscapes take us through vast landscapes of reflection, dream state and memory. Storytelling and song guides us, as a link to our collective memory and a means to navigate inner landscapes. Setting the path for a poetic and deeply haunting journey through the internal psyche that is truly transportive and escapist.

ANDROMEDA MEGA EXPRESS ORCHESTRA
8PM – 10PM

A self-organized, independent group of likeminded individuals, AMEO is unlike any other orchestra: It’s a steadily working ensemble with a steady focus on experimentation. It is comprised of in-demand musicians hailing from various countries and musical backgrounds.  Daniel Glatzel, the orchestra’s leader and saxophonist is also its main composer and producer.Widely celebrated for its explosive, intense live shows – surprisingly accessible and infectious despite the musical complexity – AMEO’s concerts are essentially colorful sonic adventure trips that cannot possibly be repeated or foreseen.

PRIMEIRO
10PM – 12AM

Primeiro is an experimental electronic artist from Buenos Aires, Argentina. His music transcends conventional boundaries, delving into the realms of ambient, hand-made trance, and techno. While his work may initially evoke a sense of tranquility akin to artists like Hiroshi Yoshimura, a closer examination reveals intricate layers and meticulous arpegios.In 2023, he released his first album, “Music for Horses,” with the Berlin-based label Danzee. He organizes the Feed the River festival, expressing that rivers are living beings and like all beings they need to be nourished, inspired by the concept of Animism and the use of sound to foster meaningful transformative dialogues.As part of the group Lujo Asiático, he has released three vinyl albums then touring in Europe and Japan.

event_name: Tag der Clubkultur - Bass Down the Iron Curtain
lineup: Gregor Rozanski, Zambon (The Very Polish Cut Outs)
information:
At the end of the 1980s, club scenes characterized by electronic house and techno sounds reached a critical mass. At the same time, all socialist governments in Central and Eastern Europe fell; there was initially a spirit of optimism and hope for more freedom and democracy. Techno in particular became the soundtrack to political and social change. As a contribution to the Day of Club Culture 2024, Soundwatch presents films and sounds from the early post-socialist party scene and reflects on their echoes today.

German premiere

Rave OmeU
PL 2024 76 min Directors: Łukasz Ronduda, Dawid Nickel
With little-seen archive footage of parties and art happenings, the film tells the story of the development of rave music and subculture in Poland. Two young ravers guide us through this world: Marysia and Janusz, as well as Marcello Zamenhoff - a performance artist and one of the pioneers of Polish rave. A fundamental question for the protagonists is how the young generation can overcome the classism in the Polish techno scene, which has been pronounced since its beginnings in the 90s.

ŁUKASZ RONDUDA is a feature film director and curator at the Museum of Modern Art in Warsaw. His films explore unusual forms of representing art and artistic processes. His debut PERFORMER won the “Think:Film Award” at the Berlin International Film Festival. His second film, A HEART OF LOVE, was presented at several international film festivals, including Berlin and Rotterdam. RAVE builds upon the exhibition “140 Beats per Minute” which he curated about techno culture and art in Poland in the 1990s.

DAWID NICKEL focuses on telling the stories of people who are perceived stereotypically because of their sexual orientation or social status. His first feature film LOVE TASTING was awarded the main prize in the micro-budget section at the Polish Film Festival. In 2023, his latest productions premiered: FILIPKA, a short documentary about his queer and gender-fluid friend, and the high-end TV series for HBO Max, #BRING BACK ALICE.

Followed by Club Sounds East lounge in the lobby and videos in the cinema.

Tag der Clubkultur is funded by Club Commission Berlin, Senate Department for Culture and Social Cohesion and Musicboard Berlin

lineup: Fazer (Squama/City Slang/D) *live
information:
Fazer sind zurück mit heulenden Motoren auf ihrem vierten Studioalbum „Yamaha“!

Die Münchner Musiker brausen durch Indie, Jazz und Psychedelic Rock, stets in bewusster Zurückhaltung, um live nochmal einen Gang höher schalten zu können.
Die Besetzung der Band mit zwei Schlagzeugen, vom englischen Mojo Magazin als “gut geölte Maschine” bezeichnet, wurde im Studio mit Posaunen, Akustikgitarren und diversen Percussions frisiert. Dabei geht es der Band immer um das Spiel mit Erwartungen, egal ob mit diesen gebrochen wird oder ob sie erfüllt werden. So werden die melancholisch-eingängigen Melodien weiterhin von Trompete und Gitarre getragen, während die Drum Grooves auf dem neuen Album mehr einem Rock Jargon entlehnt sind.

Im Oktober gehen Fazer in Deutschland auf Tour.

Für diese Veranstaltung bieten wir ermäßigte Tickets an, um auch Menschen mit kleinerem Portmonee Zugang zu Kultur zu ermöglichen. Diese Kontingente sind limitiert und nur bei TixforGigs verfügbar. Wir vertrauen auf Eure Selbsteinschätzung: Wenn ihr könnt, bucht Standard-Tickets und überlasst die ermäßigten Kontingente denjenigen, die gerade sehr sparen müssen.

event_name: NATURAL pres: SAUMET (Hybrid Set) + Ancient Yogic Wisdom Session - LIVE
lineup: Saumeth
information:
(Deutsch unten)

We are pleased to announce a new edition of our Immersive Sensory Experience "Natural", next Tuesday 08. October at the same time, 7:00 PM CET.

The results from last weeks events in the larger space has been marvellous, so we'll continue doing it in there until a big step is announced.
(Deutsch unten)

We are pleased to announce a new edition of our Immersive Sensory Experience "Natural", next Tuesday 08. October at the same time, 7:00 PM CET.

The results from last weeks events in the larger space has been marvellous, so we'll continue doing it in there until a big step is announced.

Regarding the artist, Saumet, a Berlin-based multidisciplinary artist, will perform a 120-minute hybrid set inspired by the dynamics of real life, the synergy of their recent travels, and their current soundscapes. Their live compositions are always a fresh surprise influenced by the audience."

Saumeth narrates subtly the interaction between individuals, their immediate environment and soundscapes as a full composition part of the intrinsic "real-time" synergy of expression that reflects the individual as collective understanding.

The sound design is interpreted uniquely each time, as an expression of human improvisation affected by the audience, i.e. it syntactically reads the development of social behaviours and surrounding understandings where forms and architecture are central to their connection.
Saumet creates a room for the connection of individuals, crafting an atmosphere for emotional extension and mental relaxation that open channels to meditate. Visuals invite attendees explore their minds as they immerse themselves in an illusory space of audiovisual intrinsic imagery, creating room to express their immediate thoughts and sensations through glow-in-the-dark colours.

About the artist:

Saumet has been featured by different electronic music makers and record labels, as well as performed in Buenos Aires, Montevideo, Belgrade and Berlin to name some.

He creates an environment for meditation and relaxation. You can come to explore their sound through sound design and visuals, as well as to relax yourself or even paint.

Please arrive 15 minutes before 7pm to assure your place.
7pm | 7€ (donation for the house) or 10€ incl. a drink.

Limited spots.

—————————————————

Deutsch:

Wir freuen uns, eine neue Ausgabe unserer Immersive Sensory Experience „Natural“ ankündigen zu können, die am Dienstag, den 08. Oktober zur gleichen Zeit, 19Uhr MEZ.

Die Ergebnisse der Veranstaltungen der letzten Wochen in dem größeren Raum waren großartig, also werden wir dort weitermachen, bis ein großer Schritt angekündigt wird.

Saumet, ein Berliner Künstler, der mit verschiedenen Medien arbeitet, wird ein 120-minütiges Set spielen, das eine Mischung aus verschiedenen Stilen ist. Es ist inspiriert vom echten Leben, seinen letzten Reisen und den Klängen, die er gerade hört. Seine Live-Sets sind immer eine Überraschung, beeinflusst vom Publikum.

Saumet erzählt eine Geschichte darüber, wie Menschen miteinander interagieren, ihre Umgebung und die Geräusche um sie herum. Das alles ist Teil der 'Real-Time'-Erfahrung des gemeinsamen Ausdrucks.

Das Sounddesign ist immer anders, je nach Publikum. Es ist wie eine menschliche Improvisation, die auf die Menschen um sie herum reagiert. Die Art und Weise, wie Menschen sich verhalten und verstehen, beeinflusst die Musik. Die Formen und Strukturen des Raums sind auch wichtig.

Saumet schafft einen Raum für Menschen, um sich zu verbinden. Er schafft eine Atmosphäre, in der man seine Gefühle spüren und entspannen kann. Das hilft dir zu meditieren. Die Visuals laden dich ein, deinen Geist zu erkunden, während du dich in der Welt der Bilder verlierst. Du kannst deine Gedanken und Gefühle mit den leuchtenden Farben ausdrücken.

Über den Künstler:

Saumet wurde von verschiedenen elektronischen Musikmachern und Plattenlabels vorgestellt. Er hat auch in Buenos Aires, Montevideo, Belgrad, Berlin und anderen Städten gespielt.

Er schafft eine Umgebung für Meditation und Entspannung. Du kannst kommen, um seinen Sound durch Sounddesign und Visuals zu erkunden, zu entspannen oder sogar zu malen.

Bitte kommt Ihr 15 Minuten vor 19 Uhr, um euren Plätze zu sichern.
19 Uhr | 7€ (Spende für das Haus) oder 10€ inkl. Getränk.

Begrenzte Plätze.


​_________________________
///////// ASTRAL JUNCTION - Kreativ- und Kulturhaus Berlin
Rigaer Str. 105, 10247
Berlin East/East Friedrichshain

lineup: Open Decks for Vinyl DJs
information:
VINYL ONLY! 

Jeden Dienstag ab 18:00 Uhr. Seit inzwischen mehr als 10 Jahren ist der Dienstag mit "Open Decks & Tischtennis" im Humboldthain Club eine feste Instanz für Nordberliner Bewegungsjunkies. 

Ob die Platten zum Auflegen, die Kellen fürs Tischtennis oder die Ballerinas für den Floor – jeden Dienstag könnt ihr euer Spielzeug mitbringen und vom Wochenende entschlacken. 
Ob Techno, Drum and Bass, Disco oder Mamas Schlagersammlung – jeder Stil ist willkommen und wird vom Publikum abgefeiert. 

Daher bietet der "Open Decks Abend" vielen jungen DJs eine nach wie vor einzigartige Plattform zur Darbietung ihrer Künste und zum Austausch untereinander. 

Zwei Tischtennisplatten, genug Kellen für alle, ein Kickertisch, satter Sound aus den Boxen und nicht zuletzt leckeres Bier vom Fass, tragen dazu bei, dass eine stetig wachsende Zahl an gut gelaunten Menschen den Dienstag im Humboldthain Club zu ihrer Homebase erklärt hat. 

FAQ Frage: Wie läuft das mit dem Auflegen? 
Antwort: Zu Beginn jeder Veranstaltung liegt an der Mainbar eine Liste mit den DJ-Slots für den Abend aus. 

Jeder Slot geht eine halbe Stunde und jeder DJ darf nur einen (seinen) Namen in die Liste eintragen. 
Pro Abend gibt es 20 Slots! 
Es empfiehlt sich also, nicht all zu spät zu kommen, sonst ist die Liste voll.

lineup: TECHNO MITTWOCH: TUNNEL/TURBINE/GARDEN :, Rosan, Sarica , Sub.Vision , TATA (DE) , Samuel X, Martinksd
information:
Get ready for another intense midweek session for Berlin's most dangerous day of the week to rave - WEDNESDAY Lose yourself at AVA Club in the heart of Berlin - underneath the Train Tracks of Warschauer Str S-Bahn Station. This is where your weekend starts or ends on Wednesday! Join us for Mittwoch every week to feel the rolling bass lines and deep kick drums of techno, hard techno, and trance punching through the speakers all night. And since there’s no drama at the door, everyone can experience our best and most sensual night without compromise. Just close your eyes, forget your name, forget the world: It’s Mittwoch. WARNING: Partying on a Wednesday may be hazardous to your health, studies or work...but fuck it,  

Komm in deinem besten Techno-Outfit oder einfach so, wie du dich am wohlsten fühlst. Das Wichtigste ist, dass du bereit bist, die Nacht zu erleben und dich der Musik hinzugeben. Der Techno Mittwoch ist eine Feier der TECHNO Kultur, die die Grenzen des Möglichen überschreitet. Es ist eine Einladung, in eine Welt einzutauchen, in der die Zeit stillsteht und die Musik regiert. Sichere dir jetzt deine Tickets und sei Teil dieser elektrisierenden Nacht! Lass den Alltag hinter dir und tauche ein in die Welt des Techno. Wir sehen uns auf der Tanzfläche! 

YOLO! DON'T FORGET: ARRIVE BEFORE MIDNIGHT, EACH TICKET HOLDER IS ELIGIBLE TO BRING ONE FREE GUEST!   


No Sexism, No Racism, No Homophobia.

lineup: FOOD, FLEA MARKET, ART & MUSIC
information:
Crêpes & Open Decks

As an open source concept, the desire for community and a traditional French meal becomes a communal, open gathering of music, culture and cuisine.

Join us on the banks of the Spree - the lifeline of Berlin and the place of pilgrimage for club culture enthusiasts from all over the world - the Aeden becomes a meeting place twice a month for vinyl DJs, designers, artists, creatives and music-loving people.

We would like to invite you to fill your belly with delicious Crêpes (whether savory or sweet is up to you!), accompanied by a cold beer. Get ready to enjoy music from vinyl diggers and exciting, hand-made products from local designers, surrounded by art in a paradisical garden setting.

Whether it's after work, before a birthday party or just to spontaneously enjoy a nice evening with your besties, everyone will find something to enjoy at Crêpes & Open Decks.

Want to become a part of it?
We are looking for motivated co-creators, whether vinyl DJs, local designers or talented artists.

Get in touch with us via DM on Instagram @crepes_opendecks

Join us and become part of the community.
Together we are stronger; sharing still means caring!

Entrance Fee: 6 EUR
Make sure to bring cash at the door & stores.
Card payment at the bar.

lineup: MissVergnügen, Zschaber
information:
"People are strange..." – umso schöner, wenn es dann noch die passenden Songs dazu gibt. Und noch besser, wenn das Vergnügen verspricht – oder genauer: Zschaber und Resident DJ MissVergnügen! Strange Songs for Strange People ist die legendäre Partyreihe, mit der das Vergnügen im Eschschloraque seinen Lauf nahm und sich bis heute mit immer ausgefeilteren Sets zeigt: Die Strange Songs bildeten die Anfänge ihrer Mittwochabende, die längst zum festen Ritual geworden sind. 

MissVergnügen gestaltet seit den 2000er Jahren den musikalischen Underground mit ihren eklektischen Sets und ausgesuchten Gast-DJs mit. Eine ziemlich einzigartige Energie geht von den Turntables aus, wenn musikalischer Rausch zum Vergnügen wird!

Dj Zschaber, sonst ein Verfechter des gepflegten Kontinuums, wird an diesem Abend für die spezielle Couch-Situation Platten mitbringen, die es mangels Mixbarkeit noch nie in eins seiner DJ Sets geschafft haben.
Obskura, Absurdita und Exotica mit einem dennoch wohlwollenden Blick auf Groove und Tanzbarkeit.

information:
EVERY FUCKING THURSDAY, UNITY AT KITKAT CLUB

UNITY is a vibrant kinky community of free spirits who seek to connect with their souls and bodies in a respectful, sexy, and playful manner. We have created a space where you can bring your fantasies to life and anticipate high-quality lineups, ranging from uptempo trance/neotrance to berlin uptempo techno, providing a diverse musical experience for all. We want to get behind normal DJ Gigs. Our focus on high quality berlin techno concerts and uptempo trance live Acts. 

You are a Live Band or Live Act or you are playing hybrid dj gigs? Send us an email to unity.events.berlin@gmail.com

Rules
- know the Party you go to - UNITY – and the Artists of the night.
- no strict dresscode, but: „dress for kitkat club“ – be creative!
- by purchasing a ticket, you consent to our team taking photos at the event for promotional purposes. If you prefer not to be photographed, please inform our photographer.
- UNITY tries to be a safe space for everyone. Treat others with respect. All individuals are welcome, regardless of sexual orientation, origin, or religion. Any unwanted touching, offensive language, or disrespectful behavior will result in exclusion from the event.
- if you feel uncomfortable, don't hesitate to contact our awareness team or any staff member on duty (bouncer, bar staff, etc.). We will assist you promptly!
- a no-photo policy is in place for all guests. If you want a photo get in touch with our photographer. He or she will capture images for our social media channels.

event_name: Lunchbox Candy - Sugar Free - A Sober Experience
lineup: ADAM MUNNINGS , ketia , KIM SWIM , Anita Drink
information:
It's all the flavour with none of the additives. Lunchbox Candy - Sugar Free is a chance to get high on life as we present a jam-packed evening filled with energetic house music, intimate connection, deranged performances, sexual healing, transformative workshops and oh dancing, yes there will be dancing!

We're creating a sober experience for not only those who lead a sober lifestyle or the sober curious but to all of our community for a chance to bathe in the wonders of Lunchbox Candy without consuming alcohol or any other substances. An opportunity to connect with yourself and others, naturally. 

To kick off the evening on the Candy Flip floor the amazing Phoenix Chase-Meares will facilitate a movement workshop 'How To Access The Non Fearful Body' followed by Alvin Collantes lifting our spirits higher with 'A Dose Of Pleasure'. Participation is optional but highly recommended but please remember spaces are limited. 

On The Box Floor we will have music all night long with Djs Adam Munnings, Ketia, Kim Swim and Anita Drink to keep you moving and grooving. A fire lineup of inspiring hosts / performers curated by Nancy Nutter will be sure to blow your mind and keep you entertained, gooped and gagged. Expect the unexpected, after all it's Lunchbox Candy. 

Our Love Room will be open for cuties who love to cruise hosted by Lesbo Pro (House Of Steel). It's a space for all bodies, genders and sexual orientations. Let's celebrate sexuality without the chems. Sip a mocktail, snack on some fresh fruit and trust yourself and the process cause all we're consuming is a damn good time. 

Join us October 10th at Aeden Berlin for Lunchbox Candy - Sugar Free, a sober experience open to all. Doors open at 7:30pm.

lineup: Gigi Masin (live), Marco Shuttle , Temple Rat (live), Simone Merli b2b Born in 1986
information:
CONCENTRIC RECORDS SHOWCASE II
Zenner, Berlin | October 10, 2024 | 19:00 - 00:00

Concentric Records returns to Berlin for the second edition of its live showcase at Zenner, continuing its exploration of immersive, genre-defying music. Staying true to the label’s vision, the event unites artists who navigate the spaces between sound, identity, and collective experience.

At the forefront is Gigi Masin, the Venetian composer and ambient music pioneer. With a career stretching back to the 1980s, Masin’s deeply emotional and improvisational compositions are characterized by serene atmospheres and delicate soundscapes. His ability to transport listeners into a world of calm reflection has made him a beloved figure in experimental music circles.

Also performing live is Temple Rat, a rising electronic artist from China who merges the ancient with the contemporary. Known for integrating traditional Chinese instruments like the guqin with modern ambient and electronic elements, her music evokes spiritual and mystical themes. Temple Rat’s performances are immersive, offering listeners a transcendent journey that blends ancient sounds with ethereal modernity.

On the decks, Marco Shuttle will deliver one of his signature deep and atmospheric sets. Shuttle is known for creating richly textured, hypnotic soundscapes that oscillate between dark, industrial and more experimental tones.

Opening the night will be Concentric Records’ own Simone Merli and Born In 1986, who will deliver experimental ambient DJ sets. As label founders, their sets reflect the eclectic and boundary-pushing ethos of Concentric Records, blending field recordings, deconstructed rhythms, and soundscapes that defy categorization.

Join us for a night of sound exploration, where artists blur the lines between genres, creating an unforgettable collective sonic experience.

promoters: Good Day Berlin Kultur und Veranstaltungen GmbH
lineup: Conic Rose (JazzLab/D) *live*
information:
Conic Rose: Genres als Schwarm

Hypnotische Stadtnachtfahrten und lichtdurchflutete Sehnsuchtsorte. Eine Reise ins Niemandsland zwischen Traum und Wirklichkeit, Hoffnung und Ernüchterung, Alltag und Flucht. Die Musik von Conic Rose lässt sich nur schwer auf eine gängige Formel bringen. Je nach Blickwinkel kann man sie als Indie-Pop, Jazz, Ambient oder Electronica bezeichnen, wobei Indie-Jazz vielleicht eher zutrifft.

Wer ihr Debütalbum “Heller Tag“ (2023) noch nicht kennt, hat etwas verpasst und sollte es unbedingt nachholen. Das Album ist jedenfalls mehr als die Summe aufgezählter Stile: Es schwärmt in die Genres hinein, sammelt, fügt zusammen, lässt zerfallen und beginnt immer wieder von vorne, ohne sich irgendwo zu verlieren. Die Klangkaskaden der Band klingen im Ergebnis fokussiert, dabei sind viele der Stücke nur einmal aus der Improvisation heraus eingespielt und produziert worden. Für Trompeter Konstantin Döben und Pianist/Keyboarder Johannes Arzberger sowie Gitarrist Bertram Burkert, Bassistin Franziska Aller und Drummer Silvan Strauss ist barrierefreie Offenheit die Formel, die alles zusammenhält.

Ausgehend vom heiseren Ton der Trompete, eingebettet in schwebende Klangteppiche aus elektrischer und akustischer Gitarre, Keyboards, Bass und einem Schlagzeug, das Einflüsse von J.S. Bach, Krautrock, Thom Yorke oder Bonobo erkennen lässt, entwickelt sich auf “Heller Tag“ eine Musik, die ebenso ziellos wie unbeirrbar ihren Weg findet. Das Rezept liegt in der perfekten Mischung aus intuitivem Kalkül und kalkulierter Intuition. Die Lust am eigenen Klang ist bei Conic Rose in jedem Moment spürbar. Sie übersetzt sich in Bilder, deren eindringliche Beiläufigkeit sich auf der inneren Leinwand des zuhörenden Betrachters festsetzt und weiterlebt.

Conic Rose, das ist junger, urbaner und unheimlich offener Jazz, der mit Experimentierfreude und anmutigen Klanglandschaften das Publikum vom ersten Moment an in seinen Bann zieht. So war es beim letzten Konzert im Gretchen und so wird es wieder sein. Unbedingt hingehen.

Für diese Veranstaltung bieten wir ermäßigte Tickets an, um auch Menschen mit kleinerem Portmonee Zugang zu Kultur zu ermöglichen. Diese Kontingente sind limitiert und nur bei TixforGigs verfügbar. Wir vertrauen auf Eure Selbsteinschätzung: Wenn ihr könnt, bucht Standard-Tickets und überlasst die ermäßigten Kontingente denjenigen, die gerade sehr sparen müssen.

Präsentiert von untoldency

Photo: Mitch Stoehring

______________________________________________


Trying to place Conic Rose’s music into a standard formula is almost impossible. Depending on your perspective, you could describe it as indie pop, jazz, ambient, electronica, or as a soundtrack evoking its own images. It is all of these things, and yet much more than just the sum of the listed styles. If you haven't heard their debut album 'Heller Tag' (2023), you're missing out and should definitely go and get it.

Trumpet player and bandleader Konstantin Döben describes this phenomenon as both a blessing and a curse. But that is pure understatement, because it is precisely the unmistakable sound of his husky trumpet that gives the album its special aura, floating on the tranquil soundscapes of electric and acoustic guitars, keyboards, bass — and stoic drums, which bring together the influences of J.S. Bach, Krautrock, Thom Yorke or Bonobo into a sound aesthetic that generates associations with Jon Hassell, Nils-Petter Molvaer or Toshinori Kondo’s unforgettable band IMA. „Conic Rose” does not need a catchword, because the music describes itself.

Rounding out the band is Bertram Burkert on guitar, bass and synthesizers, Franziska Aller on bass, Johannes Arzberger on keyboard/piano and Silvan Strauss on drums.

As focused as the sound cascades of Conic Rose may be, many of them came about through improvisation: they were recorded, enriched with the other instruments, and finally produced. Nothing was prepared. The band surrendered to inner moods that they could only make audible by playing them. The process was a perfect mixture of intuitive calculation and calculated intuition. The magic formula for Döben and his crew is unhampered openness in all directions.

________

For this event we offer discounted tickets to give people with less money still access to culture. These quotas are limited and only available at TixforGigs. We trust in your self-assessment: If you can, please book standard tickets and leave the reduced tickets to those who have to save money at the moment.

presented by untoldency

Photo: Mitch Stoehring

event_name: P/O Massacre, Aidan Baker, Carla Boregas & Marina Cyrino
lineup: P/O Massacre, Aidan Baker, Carla Boregas & Marina Cyrino
information:
Crunch Tapes presents:

P/O Massacre (Switzerland/Portugal)

(PONOMAREV/OBRAZEENA MASSACRE)
There have been bands called Massacre before but this one is unlike any that preceded them. They are a duo of two established musicians – saxophonist and electronics player Anton Ponomarev and guitarist Anton Obrazeena.
Obrazeena is the leader of noise rock band Jars, while Ponomarev is a member of punk-avant-jazz-noise outfits (Teufelskeller, Brom, Speedball Trio, Catatonic Leisure). He performed with Jars, and contributed saxophone to some of their recordings, and eventually the idea for a two-man project began to take shape.

Anton Ponomarev: Saxophone, Modified Pocket Trumpet, Electronics
Anton Obrazeena: Guitar, FX, Samples, Synths


Debut self-titled album was released on Utech Records (US) in the beginning of 2021 (LP/CD)
A downtuned wall of distortion so thick you can almost scoop it up in your hands and rub it on your face. This album is an immersive world of pure sound that fills the room as easily as it empties out your skull – an exquisite journey to the endless soundscapes of drone.
2 years after P/O Massacre goes deeper in their immersive noise experimentation with their second album Aural Corrosion. In this collaboration album with Alex Buess (Swiss musician, composer, sound engineer and 16-17 band leader) and Merzbow (Masami Akita) an architecture of distortion, Moog processors, spring reverb, drone effects and more, then developed in different directions by two electronic/noise veterans. It’s a journey of pure sensation, destruction, and rebirth. A skull-vibrating sound decomposition to your face.

+

Aidan Baker (Nadja)

Experimental musician from Toronto, Ontario, Canada who has released numerous records both as a solo artist and as part of various side projects, including Nadja, ARC, Caudal and Mnemosyne. 

+

Carla Boregas & Marina Cyrino

Carla Boregas is a Berlin-based Brazilian musician and sound artist. Her practice is focused on the creation of sonic environments through the manipulation of synthesizers, field recordings and acoustic sounds with emphasis on texture, repetition and sensoriality. She works across the spectrum of composition, improvisation, performance and sound installation. She also collaborates with artists from dance, film and theater fields. Recently Carla released her debut solo album called "Pena ao Mar" on the Swedish imprint iDEAL Recordings.

Marina Cyrino is a Brazilian flutist and sound artist currently based in Berlin. Her flute playing is characterized by singular techniques developed through the use of inside amplification. The rhythmic use of the flute, the extensive use of objects and balloons attached to the instrument, and the use of disassembled flute parts are other striking elements of her playing.


Doors: 19:00
Start: 20:00

Location: Hinterraum
Address: Herzbergstr. 65, 10365 Berlin

event_name: Kindness Single Release Show and Party
lineup: live:, Riah Knight, Nansea,  , DJs:, Camilla Rae (Body Langauge), Skankstasy (Lecken)
information:
Join us for a kind evening of live shows and DJ sets at Engels. We're celebrating the release of "Kindness" with music and dancing

7.30pm - doors open
line-up:
8.30pm - Riah
9.00pm - Nansea
DJ sets will be announced soon!

"As brat summer comes to a close, as the world continues to choose violence, as we reap a fall harvest off bitter truths... Nansea interjects with a chaser of sweetness to the bitterness.
A welcome foray into more R'n'B-inflected version of their singular sound, "Kindness" relays a story of acceptance, much-needed in the wake of an implicitly devastating breakup. […].
You deserve kindness. Give it to yourself ."
- words by LIAR

Riah: 
Riah Knight is a British-Romani artist based in Berlin. She first gained recognition in theatre and regularly performs, writes and composes music for productions at the Maxim Gorki Theatre and with the feminist collective Glossy Pain. Knight’s music paints an evocative landscape, woven within traditions of R&B, folk, trip-hop and performance poetry, her muscular songwriting and sultry voice create a sonic landscape for the political reimagining of female aggression and desire. Her upcoming EP ‘Wicked Laughter’ - out November 8th - is the latest offspring of her ongoing collaboration with producer Shaban. The latest single, ‘Yours’, came out in September 2024.

Nansea: 
Marek's Alter Ego Nansea (ˈnænsi) reclaims a homophobic slur, transforming it into a balm of polyphonic fractals, with synth waves and 80s-inspired drum machines. Marek’s wondrous voice glides above it all, defying genre and gender boundaries, residing in a secret realm between Rosalia and Ravel. Polish-born and raised in a small German town, Nansea eventually found home in Berlin. Her performances expanded from Kreuzkölln's bars to Berlin institutions like HKW, Berghain Kantine, and Torstrassen Festival. Collaborations with local artists led to work with the queer collective GOLOSA and the 2021 Sheena McGrandles project Dawn. Her lyrical focus on community, the queer experience, and gender fluidity has shaped a fluid, evolving style, from 2019’s Comfort EP to the upcoming single 'Kindness,' releasing in October 2024.

event_name: demo station: Performance von Petra Hermanova
lineup: Petra Hermanova
information:
Im Rahmen des ersten Langen Abends und als Teil des öffentlichen Programms zur Ausstellung DAS GLÜCK IST NICHT IMMER LUSTIG von Rirkrit Tiravanija präsentiert die Sängerin und Komponistin Petra Hermanova einen Auszug aus ihrem Solodebüt In Death’s Eyes mit einer Schlagzeugintervention ihres langjährigen Kollegen, dem norwegischen Perkussionisten und Sänger Jon Eirik Boska.

Die demo station von Rirkrit Tiravanija ist eine bühnenähnliche Skulptur und lädt Menschen dazu ein, etwas zu „demonstrieren“. Tiravanija versteht den Begriff dabei im doppelten Sinn – als politischen Protest oder als Vorführung von etwas, das jemand besonders gut kann oder gerne mag. Über die Laufzeit der Ausstellung bietet die demo station täglich Raum für öffentliche Auftritte.

Als Teil des öffentlichen Programms zur Ausstellung DAS GLÜCK IST NICHT IMMER LUSTIG von Rirkrit Tiravanija lädt der Gropius Bau zu einer monatlichen Serie Langer Abende ein. Neben der Performance finden am gleichen Abend eine Buchvorstellung mit Josephine Apraku, Eric Otieno Sumba, Sharonda Quainoo und Nadine Nzambisa Ngolo, eine Kochshow von Luiza Prado De O. Martins sowie eine Filmvorführung von Rirkrit Tiravanija und ein DJ-Set mit Ayzon statt.

Petra Hermanova ist eine Sängerin und Komponistin, die vorwiegend mit der Autoharp arbeitet. Die in Berlin lebende Künstlerin veröffentlichte ihr Solodebüt In Death’s Eyes im Oktober 2023 auf dem Label Unguarded. In neun Stücken, die zwischen Gesang und schweren, verzerrten Drones pendeln, setzt Hermanova die Autoharp, Stimme und Pfeifenorgel mit Techniken aus der Folk- und Sakraltradition ein, um sich mit den spirituellen und irdischen Dimensionen von schwerem Verlust und Trauer auseinanderzusetzen. In einer stringenten Darbietung von Schönheit, Schmerz und scharfsinniger Musikalität bringt Hermanova ein beeindruckendes Album hervor, auf dem der gefeierte Organist Denny Wilke an der Ladegast-Orgel des Merseburger Doms spielt. Das Album wurde für mehrere Preise nominiert, unter anderem für den tschechischen Grammy. Sie ist mit früheren Projekten international auf Tournee gegangen, darunter eine umfangreiche Zusammenarbeit mit Jon Eirik Boska und ihrer von der Kritik gefeierten Band Fiordmoss.

Bei der Veranstaltung werden ggfs. Foto- und Videoaufnahmen entstehen, auf denen Sie zu erkennen sein könnten. Mit Ihrem Besuch willigen Sie ein, dass diese Aufnahmen zur Kommunikation der Veranstaltung bzw. Ausstellung verwendet werden.
