lineup: Kazy Lambist
information:
Eleganter Elektropop für tanzende Tagträumer

Kazy Lambist alias Arthur Dubreucq beweist, dass der so genannte French Touch in der elektronischen Musik nach wie vor lebendig ist und Bedeutendes hervorbringt. Seine Musik ist schwebend und verträumt, sinnlich und voller Emotionen. Einige sagen Chill-Wave dazu und das bedeutet, dass sich hinter einer vordergründigen Eingängigkeit eine lebendige und tanzbare Melancholie verbirgt: raffiniert und hedonistisch, flüchtig und elegant, entspannt und charaktervoll.

Nach einer Reihe von Singles und EPs und einer ausgedehnten internationalen Tournee schlägt Kaziy Lambist nun das zweite Kapitel auf und präsentiert sein neues Album „Moda“, benannt nach dem Istanbuler Künstler*innenviertel auf der asiatischen Seite des Bosporus. Hier hat er eine Zeit lang gelebt und gemeinsam mit Sedef Sebüktekin den Song “Dünya" aufgenommen. Darüber hinaus entstand “Moda Disko“ (in Zusammenarbeit mit Den Ze), eine mitreißende Italo-Disco-Kollaboration, die sich der vibrierenden Lebendigkeit dieses Viertels widmet. Geografisch ist das Album sehr weit gefasst und bezieht seine Inspiration aus der Türkei, Italien und Südfrankreich. “Moda“ verwebt nahtlos elektronische und organische Klänge und strebt sowohl nach klanglicher Ekstase als auch nach introspektiver Traurigkeit.

Kazy Lambist brilliert in verschiedenen Stimmungen und Geschwindigkeiten. Seine Musik lädt gleichermaßen zum Tagträumen in der Hängematte, zum Tanzen in einer gemütlichen Lounge oder auf einem hypnotischen, sonnengeküssten Dancefloor ein.

Photo: Antoine Henault

_____________________________________________



KAZY LAMBIST 
NEW ALBUM / « MODA »
Kazy Lambist persistently navigates the realm of his friction-less, conflict-free sounds with a music both welcoming and panoramic, sophisticated and hedonistic, volatile and elegant, relaxed yet full of character. While others might resort to using their electronic arsenal for more aggressive means, Kazy Lambist, inspired by sensuality and emotions, refuses to confine himself to certain restricted musical niches. Not surprising for an artist who’s been striving to push boundaries since his early days, looking to offer an extensive vision to his audience, inviting listeners to daydream in their hammock, dance away in a cosy lounge or on a hypnotic sun-kissed dance-floor. His first viral hit “Doing Yoga”, had earned him the new talent Inrocks Lab audience award in 2015, film director Guillermo Del Toro’s enthusiastic endorsement and led to a collaboration with fashion designer Jean-Charles de Castelbajac. Subsequently, he released the stellar breakthrough album 33 000 Ft, undeniably making a name for himself on the electro-pop scene. 
Kazy Lambist is now ready to launch the second chapter, an LP almost six years in the making that shouldn’t be mistaken for the result of great artistic inertia. The fresh-faced thirty-year old still delighted us with his interim output including, the breezy Sky Kiss EP with a compelling Jean-Benoît Dunckel (Air) collaboration, breathing a new, more classic life into some of his early successes (Decrescendo EP), and a few more exploratory wanderings (‘Nasty’ together with Italian rapper Tutti Fenomeni). He also made the world dance with his live shows and Dj sets, confirming his global appeal with a platinum-certified single (‘Love Song’), five gold-certified singles (‘Doing Yoga’, ‘Headson’, ‘On You’, ‘Annecy’ and ‘Work’) and a worldwide tour bookended by a 20-concert US tour alongside fellow French outfit Kid Francescoli. Leading the international acclaim is Turkey, where his success was firmly established following a recent spat of gigs and a month-and-a-half long residence in the artistic neighborhood of Moda, located on the Asian side of the Bosphorus strait. This oriental retreat inspired the name for his new album, Moda, where Kazy Lambist - real name Arthur Dubreucq -  recorded ‘Dünya’, a seraphic effort featuring the soothing vocals of Sedef Sebüktekin over Turkish violins and Jowee Omicil’s saxophone. Similarly ‘Moda Disko’, a jubilant Italo-disco collaboration with singer Den Ze would have fitted perfectly in the soundtrack for Italian movie La Grande Bellezza.
Produced with the help of Glasses (seen on “Love Song” and “Oh My God”) with Ash Workman (Metronomy, Christine and the Queens, Baxter Dury…) officiating behind the mixing desk, the collaborative record, featuring a wealth of instrumental cameos from different background, seamlessly weaves the electronic and more organic sounds together. Geographically expansive, the album draws inspiration from Turkey, Italy (where he lived for two years during the album conception), the South of France (his native Montpellier) with the symbolic Mediterranean serving as a common thread. The album immerses itself in the limbo of a flourishing chill-wave, manifesting in various bustling forms. The album narrates tales of love, striving for both sonic ecstasy and introspective sorrow (‘After All’), a combination that oozes enough suave (‘Italian Way’) and golden reflections (‘Somebody To Love’), to shine at variable speeds and better suit the listener’s mood. This fluid type of pop (‘Nirvana’ featuring Californian singer Julietta) adorns more voluptuously solar highlights to express the disintegration of the relationship between an artist and his muse (‘Lost’ with longtime stage collaborator Amouë), or becomes more restless in the immoderate elation of wine celebration (‘Méditerranée’). The music also takes on a groovy sensuality on ‘Flawless Form’, accompanied by the Strasbourg jazz collective Emile Londonien. With Moda, Kazy Lambist explores beyond the borders, all the time preserving a perfect balance between refinement and pleasure.

Photo: @ Antoine Henault

information:
Get ready for another intense midweek session for Berlin's most dangerous day of the week to rave - WEDNESDAY Lose yourself at AVA Club in the heart of Berlin - underneath the Train Tracks of Warschauer Str S-Bahn Station. This is where your weekend starts or ends on Wednesday! Join us for Mittwoch every week to feel the rolling bass lines and deep kick drums of techno, hard techno, and trance punching through the speakers all night. And since there’s no drama at the door, everyone can experience our best and most sensual night without compromise. Just close your eyes, forget your name, forget the world: It’s Mittwoch. WARNING: Partying on a Wednesday may be hazardous to your health, studies or work...but fuck it,  

Come in your best techno outfit or whatever you feel most comfortable. The most important thing is that you are ready to experience the night and surrender to the music. Techno Wednesday is a celebration of TECHNO culture that pushes the boundaries of what is possible. It is an invitation to immerse yourself in a world where time stands still and music reigns. Get your tickets now and be part of this electrifying night! Leave everyday life behind you and immerse yourself in the world of techno. See you on the dance floor!

information:
on the couch: Ivanka & MissVergnügen

Musikalische Rituale von der Couch aus? Was nach Musiktherapie klingt, ist pures Vergnügen: Resident DJ Missvergnügen gestaltet seit den 2000er Jahren den musikalischen Underground mit ihren eklektischen Sets und ausgesuchten Gast-DJs. 

Eine ziemlich einzigartige Energie geht von den Turntables aus, während ihr Abend, jeden Mittwoch (!), zum festen Ritual geworden ist. Undenkbar ist die Mitte der Woche ohne sie, garantiert ist das Vergnügen – einmal mehr mit Ivanka als treue Wegbegleiterin auf der Couch!

Iwanka Skrivanek ist eine Komponistin, Sounddesignerin, Soundtrackerin und DJ mit einer Schatzkiste voller goldener Geschichten aus der ganzen Welt. Sie ist Kommissarin und Mitwirkende bei der Cloud Commission, einer Kunstgruppe in Moskau, die Filme und künstlerische Forschungen zu verschiedenen Wolkenformen produziert. Als Keyboarderin spielt sie für Ersatzmusika (Piranha Music).

UNITY is a vibrant kinky community of free spirits who seek to connect with their souls and bodies in a respectful, sexy, and playful manner. lineup: Vincent Peirani (ACT/FR) *live* // Jokers, w. Ziv Ravitz & Federico Casagrande, , Sean Steinfeger (Opening DJ-Set/D)
information:
Der Akkordeonist Vincent Peirani gilt als einer der kreativsten Musiker der europäischen Jazzszene und betritt mit seinem Instrument immer wieder neue Wege – virtuos und überraschend. Mit seinem Projekt Jokers wendet er sich dem klassischen Format des Jazztrios zu, um mit dessen Konventionen gleich wieder zu brechen. Seine beiden Mitstreiter, Federico Casagrande an der Gitarre und Ziv Ravitz an Schlagzeug und Keyboards, verfügen beide über einen reichen Erfahrungsschatz, ein Interesse an Rock und elektronischer Musik und eine Vorliebe für musikalische Hybridität. Ob Solist, Rhythmiker, Akzentuierer, Farbgeber oder vieles mehr: Die Idee hinter dieser Besetzung ist das spontane Wechselspiel der musikalischen Rollen untereinander. Gemeinsam taucht das Trio mit der Freiheit des Jazz in eine cineastische und üppige Klangwelt ein, die ebenso überrascht wie verzaubert. Ein fantasievolles Jazz-Fusion-Rock-Electronica-Abenteuer mit Spannung, Poesie, Rhythmus, virtuosen Ausbrüchen und intimen Momenten.

Wir empfehlen zur Einstimmung das gleichnamige Album, das neben sehr persönlichen und eigenständigen Coverversionen von Marilyn Manson, Bishop Briggs oder den Nine Inch Nails auch Eigenkompositionen, vor allem von Peirani selbst, enthält. Trotz aller Einflüsse aus anderen Genres ist Jokers letztlich ein klares Jazzprojekt: Im Mittelpunkt steht die Interaktion. Die drei Musiker hören einander zu, kommunizieren und erwecken so das Ausgangsmaterial zum Leben. Und sie wandeln auf verschlungenen Pfaden, die erst im Moment des Zusammenspiels entstehen und sich immer wieder neu verzweigen.

In Kindheit und Jugend zunächst klassisch ausgebildet, entdeckte Vincent Peirani mit 16 Jahren den Jazz für sich und studierte später am Pariser Konservatorium - dem einzigen in Frankreich, dessen Jazzabteilung Akkordeonisten aufnahm. Seitdem hat er die Sprache des Akkordeons mit seinem Gespür für Stilkreuzungen und ungewöhnliche Klangfarben grundlegend erneuert. Als lupenreiner Jazzmusiker, dem aber auch Weltmusik, Klassik, Chanson oder Pop leicht von der Hand gehen, engagiert er sich in verschiedenen Projekten, denen er mit seinem dynamischen und innovativen Spiel einen besonderen Zauber verleiht.

Für diese Veranstaltung bieten wir ermäßigte Tickets an, um auch Menschen mit kleinerem Portmonee Zugang zu Kultur zu ermöglichen. Diese Kontingente sind limitiert und nur bei TixforGigs verfügbar. Wir vertrauen auf Eure Selbsteinschätzung: Wenn ihr könnt, bucht Standard-Tickets und überlasst die ermäßigten Kontingente denjenigen, die gerade sehr sparen müssen.

Photo: Stanislas Augris

______________________________________---


For this event we offer discounted tickets to give people with less money still access to culture. These quotas are limited and only available at TixforGigs. We trust in your self-assessment: If you can, please book standard tickets and leave the reduced tickets to those who have to save money at the moment.

event_name: Against Interpretation presents: Courtesy - intimate yell
lineup: Säule: , Byron Yeates, Courtesy, Klō, S-candalo
information:
Die dänische DJ und Produzentin Courtesy aka Najaaraq Vestbirk präsentiert intimate yell mit Stil: Ihr zweites Album besteht aus einer Mischung aus Deep House, 2-Step, 90er IDM und Ambient, begleitet von einer 15-minütigen Videocollage, die in Zusammenarbeit mit der Fotografin Laura Schaeffer entstanden ist und heute im CCA Berlin – Center for Contemporary Arts gezeigt wird. Danach wird die Against Interpretation-Labelbegründerin und NTS-Resident in die Säule gehen, um in guter Gesellschaft zu feiern: Byron Yeates und das Geschwister-Duo S-candalo, die gemeinsam auch die Party La Noche veranstalten, werden zusammen mit dem break-begeisterten DJ Klo- auflegen.

Danish DJ/producer Courtesy aka Najaaraq Vestbirk is launching intimate yell in style: her second album is a force majeure of deep house, 2-step, 90s IDM and ambient, accompanied by a 15-minute video collage created in collaboration with photographer Laura Schaeffer, screening today at the CCA Berlin – Center for Contemporary Arts. Afterwards, the Against Interpretation label owner and NTS resident will head to Säule to celebrate in good company: the co-promoters of club night La Noche, Byron Yeates and sibling duo S-candalo, will be playing along with breaks-loving DJ Klō.

event_name: Aurora Edition: Yanling + Jan Urbiks + Amedeo Cappelletti + Tim Novikov (AV)
lineup: Yanling (Live), Choir: Annika Dörner, Hannah Endrulat, Dinah Kouyaté, Mathilda Adamik, Jan Urbiks (Live), Amedeo Cappelletti (Live), Tim Novikov (AV)
information:
Aurora Edition is an avant-garde series of ambient, drone, and experimental live concerts. It takes place in selected institutions and venues. Each live show features customized audio and video projections onto the domes and walls of the respective architecture. With the goal of seamlessly blending music and visuals, Aurora collaborates with multiple artists for each edition, creating impressive atmospheres that perfectly complement and enhance the architectural setting.

Since the series was founded in 2023, Aurora Edition has also evolved into a record label, introducing its first release with Yanling's Cymatic. In the October edition at Silent Green, Yanling will present her new album Cymatic along with a four-person women-led choir, accompanied by performances from Jan Urbiks and Amedeo Cappelletti. Audiovisual artist Tim Novikov will shape the program visually with custom dome projections.

lineup: Gary Beck, Jon Hester, Oliver Deutschmann, Sanna Mun, , Tiefschwarz, Vio PRG, Selina (DE)
information:
▆  About the Expeditions
The Expeditions series was founded in spring 2018 with a clear vision of breaking out of the monotony that defines most pure Techno nights in Berlin. The concept is to create a clear musical distinction between the different parts of the night, while remaining loyal to the classical and traditional aspects of Techno: from Detroit groove to hypnotic and atmospheric storytelling. We emphasize energy and progression. We strive to create a clear beginning and a decisive end. We believe in Techno as a journey, designed for the dance floor, rather than for podcasts. Following this principle, we curate the second floor with classic, warm, chord-led interpretations of House music, that serve as a perfect contrast to the main floor program. Occasionally, you might even find a third floor hidden in the vast garden of :// about blank. Explore, that's what the Expeditions is about.

▆  What to expect
⦿ A Power Deck with well curated interpretations of pure Techno music. No minimalism, no sophisticated preaching. 
⦿ A Comfort Deck with a contrasting program, curated with the finest House music: classic Chicago House, Soulful and New York Garage, and Berlin contemporary touches.
⦿ DJs at eye level, musically educated audience and Berlin underground at its best. 

▆ FAQ
 ⦿ Is there a dress-code? - No, the Expeditions doesn't have a dress code, but we do encourage you to be creative when choosing an outfit for the party., and to leave your everyday behind.
⦿ Is taking photos inside the club allowed?
- No. The Expeditions, and :// about blank have a strict no-photo policy. We also strongly encourage you to check in your phone at the cloakroom and lose the feeling of time. This is, however, not mandatory.⦿ Is the Expeditions a safe space for minority groups?
- The Expeditions, and :// about blank in general, are a safe space for any ethnicity, gender or sexual orientation. Any sign of racism, sexism, antisemitism, or homophobia will not be tolerated. In addition, you are requested to familiarize yourself with the principles of consent, and to respect the personal space of any fellow guest. In case you feel that you have been treated wrongly, or that your space has been violated, please notify our staff at the entrance immediately.

event_name: We Are Not Alone by Ellen Allien
promoters: RSO.BERLIN, BPitch / We Are Not Alone
lineup: ROBUS:, ALI3N , Carmen Electro, Ellen Allien , Endlec, Headless Horseman live, madwoman, Miro Von Berlin , Parrish Smith , Rommek , SALOME , Shaleen, Stephanie Sykes , Tensal, Tigerhead , Öspiel live, VEL (3), Vera Grace  , , SUMME:, Aexhy , Cardopusher live, DJ Europarking, Callum Magnum , DJ Europarking , Metaraph b2b OLHA , MarcelDune  , Raven (CA)
information:
Carmen Electro's DJing style reflects her personality: authentic, respectful of musical legacy, and consistently innovative. This approach defines her techno sets and selection, where her passion for the genre drives her to bring fresh and unexpected elements to the forefront. As a vibrant and influential figure in the global underground techno scene, Carmen is renowned for her energetic presence and dedication to the craft. On October 25th, Ellen Allien descends on the compound with We Are Not Alone and hosts Carmen Electro, Öspiel, Tensal, Endlec and more for a weekender that spans from Friday night to Monday morning.

INFO

• Located on the grounds of the former Bärenquell brewery factory in East Berlin.
• 2 converted Warehouse dancefloors with state of the art sound systems.
• Custom made by Kirsch Audio. 40kW, 48 channels, 153 drivers, signature horn technology
• cash and cashless payment
• 5 min walk from Schöneweide station, 4 stops from Ostkreuz and 3 stops from Neukölln with S-Bahn
• 18 minutes by Bus 165 from Schlesisches Tor

ONLINE PRESALE:
Please note that having a presale ticket does not assure admission. The club reserves the right to decline entry, with tickets refunded accordingly. Please anticipate potential delays due to enhanced security checks at the entrance, even for ticket holders. Your cooperation and understanding are greatly appreciated. Thank you.

On the big concert-stage of Schwuz, presented by karaokejesus.

This is the ultimate chance for you to show the world how fierce you are and how much you love Mother Monster and her iconic songs.

KARAOKE-PARTICIPATION:
We're singing/performing Gaga bangers only. To request a song, you have to submit your song-wish between 20:00-20:30 before the show starts. The earlier you come, the bigger your chances to snatch a Gaga song and sing/perform it on stage. This is a concert, so come in time, before 20:00

LADY GAGA COSTUME CONTEST:

information:
A Festival for Contemporary Sounds of Asia and North Africa. 

Future East Festival’s 4th edition “EXTENSION” will resonate across three floors of Musikbrauerei, showcasing an exciting spectrum of genres in Electronic and Electro-acoustic music, as well as A/V performances and club night featuring a curated selection of artists from Asia and North Africa.

The Festival Club night (Future Goes Late), invites AN(8)X, KUDUR, and KWIA alongside Future East to create a diverse and unique experience of Berlin’s night life, Expect an unforgettable fusion of sounds and communities, showcasing the vibrant spirit of the city after dark.
_________________________________

AN(8)X is a Berlin-based artist group curating hybrid art events with a focus on audiovisual performances that spotlight queer, FLINTA artists with ESEA backgrounds. Focused on radical experimentation and community, they showcase the raw, hyper-regional sound of East and Southeast Asia's underground scene.

KUDUR is a Berlin-based collective and party series led by trans/queer BIPOC members, focused on creating safer spaces for community and artistic expression. Inspired by the Mediterranean's rich history, Kudur crosses genre, border, and generational boundaries, blending music, culture, and politics while preserving its members' cultural roots and challenging social norms.

KWIA is a no-longer-secret, ambient-focused listening bar situated along Berlin's Maybachufer that follows in the tradition of Japanese jazz kissas —bars with high-end sound systems for attentive listening. Bringing this rare audio culture to Berlin, KWIA offers a queer, musically open space featuring contemplative electronic music.

lineup: BIIANCO , Xenia , T78 , VIDO (2) , GNRØ
teepee (CZ) + Varley (Support act)
information:
Light and darkness. Eyes closed on a journey to your own emotions. The melodies change the rhythm of your heartbeat, while you silently listen to every word sung. It feels like we are all connected and it’s so obviously honest, real, and it’s earnest…

With their performances, teepee aims to create a welcoming and safer space, a parallel world where you can stop for a moment and let go. It is a space where any sign of difference is embraced, a place to observe the wonders buried deep within you. Soulful vocal harmonies and captivating melodies help capture the magic between Tereza Lavičková and Miroslav Patočka, who formed the dream-pop project teepee in 2015 and have been exploring the space between electric and acoustic elements ever since. Subtle samples and synthetic sounds provide a bed for their melancholic, honest and confessional lyrics. Over time, they have enriched their original sound which is rooted in indie-folk with more electronic and pop elements, highlighted by the involvement of new live musicians.

teepee is a pretty well established band from the Czech Republic with three released studio albums and over 1 million streams on Spotify. They have also played numerous shows throughout Europe and at some major showcase festivals such as Eurosonic Noorderslag, Enea Spring Break, Waves Vienna and Reeperbahn Festival. Right before the outbreak of the Covid-19 pandemic, the band played their biggest European tour in support of the British duo Seafret which also included a sold out show in Berlin.

Every shade and subgenre of electronic music has its place here, from fast, groovy techno to uplifting house music, from chugging EBM to frenetic breakbeat stompers.

lineup: SECRET LINEUP
information:
◈ Performance Based, Immersive Event ◈

● Enter a new world with every floor
● Extensive performance lineup
● Secret music lineup
● Awareness team

◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈

◈ What to expect? ◈
Every floor will be curated by a different art collective, each bringing its own visual design, storytelling, music, and performances to create three unique worlds to explore. These worlds are connected through the Liminal Space, a surreal realm where different realities collide and glitch together, resulting in bizarre performances of roaming creatures. Visit our Insta to get a feeling for the different worlds --> @liminal.events
● Babylon3000: retro-future, silver, metallic, cult-like, hedonistic, technoid, fast.
● The Hilton: extra-fluffy, bouncy, colorful, slutty, juicy, sassy.
● The Naked Tea Party: warm, naked, connected, cozy, aware, slow.
● Liminal Space: glitchy, bizarre, uncanny.

◈ Was erwartet dich? ◈
Jedes Kollektiv übernimmt einen der Floors um ein einzigartiges Design mit eigener Storyline, Musik-Lineup und Performance-Lineup zu kreiren. So entstehen drei verschiedene Welten die darauf warten erkundet zu werden. Diese Welten sind durch den Liminal Space verbunden: Einer surrealen Umgebung, in der Welten verschmelzen und bizarre Performances hinter jeder Ecke auf dich warten. Besuche uns auf Instagram um ein Gefühl für die verschiedenen Welten zu bekommen --> @liminal.events
● Babylon3000: retro-futuristisch, silber, metallisch, kultartig, technoid, schnell.
● The Hilton: extra-flauschig, bunt, slutty, frech, bouncy.
● The Naked Tea Party: warm, nackt, verbunden, gemütlich, aware, langsam.
● Liminal Space: glitchy, bizarr, ungewöhnlich.

◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈

◈ FAQ ◈
> Is there a dress code?
The usual Kater Blau door policy applies. However, we encourage you to bring a character to the event to become a part of it.

> Why the secret music lineup?
Join for the experience and not for a single headliner. Since DJs have enough spotlight in the club environment, we decided to refocus attention on art collectives, performers, storylines, and the awareness concept. Here are some key facts about the musical program:
● Every floor = different music: technoid, bouncy-dirty, and slow. 
● Gender-balanced lineup.
● Artists are allowed to post, so if you dig a bit you will find out. 

> Why the Awareness Team?
We are trying to create an equalizing space, in which it does not matter who you are. A space where you can get a brief rest from the overregulated outside world and experience connection and play while your boundaries are respected. As much as we want to believe in this utopia, we know such an environment can be exploited. The awareness team is a low-barrier touchpoint for you if you experience any form of boundary crossing or discrimination. They are here to listen, take you out of the situation, and assist you if you are unwell. 

◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈●◈

-END OF TRANSMISSION- 

___________________

Limited presale. More tickets are available at the club.

A presale ticket does not guarantee entry, and the club reserves the right to refuse admission. In case of refusal, the ticket price will be refunded via RA (excluding fees).

lineup: Panorama Bar: , David Elimelech, ISAbella, Kodemul, Partok, Roi Perez, Samira
information:
Laundrette lädt zum nächsten Vollwaschgang ein, bei dem sich David Elimelech, Partok und Roi Perez wie immer die Booth mit verschiedenen queeren DJs aus aller Welt teilen. Samira ist ein exzellenter palästinensischer House-DJ, der bereits bei der letzten Laundrette in der Panorama Bar aufgelegt hat. Er war Resident im palästinensischen Club Kabareet in Haifa, der im September nach neun Jahren leider seine Pforten schloss. ISAbella ist eine der Mitgründer*innen von MARICAS, einer auf FLINTA* fokussierten queeren Party in Barcelona, die einen lebendigen Mix aus progressivem House, Breakbeats und Trance spielt. Kodemul kommt aus Mexiko und ist der Veranstalter von Por Detroit, einer queeren Partyreihe in Mexico City und Los Angeles.

Laundrette is hosting another spin cycle, where David Elimelech, Partok and Roi Perez will be sharing the booth as usual with various queer DJs from all over the world. Samira is an excellent Palestinian house DJ, returning to Panorama Bar after the last edition of Laundrette. He was a resident at the Palestinian club Kabareet in Haifa, which sadly shut down in September after nine years. ISAbella is one of the co-founders of MARICAS, a FLINTA*-focused queer party in Barcelona that offers a vibrant mix of progressive house, breakbeats and trance. Kodemul from Mexico is mind behind Por Detroit, a queer party series in Mexico City and Los Angeles.

event_name: Valentina Magaletti & Theresa Baumgartner • Noémi Büchi • Zavoloka
lineup: Valentina Magaletti , Theresa Baumgartner , Noémi Büchi, Zavoloka
information:
In Cooperation with Heroines of Sound Edition #3  • Konzert, AV Show

In cooperation with the feminist electronic music festival Heroines of Sound, Volksbühne presents exciting audio-visual live sets by Valentina Magaletti & Theresa Baumgartner, Noémi Büchi and Ukrainian electronica whiz Zavoloka, in a cooperation with the feminist electronic music festival Heroines of Sound . Expect a multifaceted spectrum of immersive drones, straddling noise avant-garde, field recordings, experimental pop and visual media. Electronic music as symphonic maximalist mix – inspired by the embodiment of sound.

Valentina Magalotti & Theresa Baumgartner: LUCHA LIBRE

Friction loss, glitch, clash - drummer Valentina Magaletti’s compositions for drums and percussive instruments adopt a very inventive approach. On LUCHA LIBRE, she showcases the wildest variations of her versatile techniques exploring technoid sound art in dungeon sound volume, textural rhythms and the amazing potential of consonance and dissonance. Complex, non-linear time situations oscillating within a rhythmical continuum between simple structures, poly-rhythmic overlays and pure chaos, are translated into a dazzling AV show by Theresa Baumgartner in this Berlin debut.

Noémi Büchi: DOES IT STILL MATTER 

Noémi Büchi’s AV set Does It Still Matter will be a German premiere, on show in Berlin for the first time. The music is an exquisite mix of textural drones and delicate yet complex rhythms. Hypnotic cluster compositions made of film music, sound sculptures, classical music fragments and jazzy patches are combined to productively clash in a symphony of sound textures.  Does It Still Matter rounds off a series of previous releases comprising Matière and Matter, all focusing on the embodiment of sound and the physicality of music. Büchi’s sound structures and aesthetic choices are exploring the idea of materiality in an increasingly liquid, fluid, immaterial world.

Zavoloka

Kateryna Zavoloka, sound and media artist, composer and performer from Ukraine, is uncompromisingly devoted to leftfield music free from genre expectations and stylistic requirements. She will present her latest tracks in an elaborate audio-visual set created by the artist herself. Experimental electronic music peppered with references to Ukrainian folk music, and club music combined with analogue instrument use are her speciality, and very accessible at that. Traditional music instruments like the kobza, a Ukrainian guitar, and spilka and kolianka flutes allude to folk songs from Ukraine to soon get lost in an imaginary distance, which adds an almost meditative touch. The focus is on forward-pushing electronic beats that are at once dynamic and lingering. Her last album Amulet was nominated for “best album of the year” in 2022 by various music magazines. Kateryna Zavoloka lives in Berlin.

event_name: Verboten Berlin - Mountains of Glass Tour 2024
lineup: Verboten Berlin
information:
Alexander Freund alias Verboten Berlin kündigt die „Mountains Of Glass“-Tour an, die im Oktober 2024 starten wird.

Fünf ausgewählte Termine in München, Zürich, Wien, Hamburg und Berlin sind geplant. Der exklusive Presale startet ab sofort im Ticketshop: undercover.de. Verboten Berlin ist bekannt für die Verschmelzung von elektronischen Neo-Kraut-Elementen mit den vielfältigen musikalischen Einflüssen der Berliner Clubkultur. Musiker und Produzent Alexander Freund, der kreative Kopf hinter dem Projekt, gießt darin seine Leidenschaft für das Komponieren und Songwriting in innovative Songs. Die Tracks von Verboten Berlin wurden bereits von Künstlern wie Booka Shade, Rodriguez Jr., Tube & Berger und Monkey Safari geremixt und gesungen und haben es in renommierten Editorial-Playlists wie Low Key Tech und New Music Friday geschafft. Das Ergebnis ist eine stetig wachsende Anhängerschaft.

2024 zieht es Verboten Berlin wieder auf die Bühne. Einige ausgewählte Clubshows sind geplant – neben Deutschland stehen auch Österreich und die Schweiz auf dem Tourplan. Verboten Berlin-Konzerte sind dabei alles andere als gewöhnlich. „Für mich bedeutet Freiheit, dass keiner oben oder unten steht, dass wir uns auf Augenhöhe begegnen – und das verfolge ich auf Tour und mit dem Album,“ betont Alexander Freund. „Ich möchte nicht der Ansager sein, nicht die Gefühle anleiten und das Publikum an die Hand nehmen. Ich möchte, dass wir das gemeinsam machen […]“ Das neue Album „Mountains Of Glass“ sieht Freund dabei, ebenso wie die vorherigen Veröffentlichungen, lediglich als Rahmen. „Besonders freue ich mich darauf, jeden Abend mit einem neuen Track, Beat oder Song von der Bühne zu kommen, entstanden in gemeinsamen Momenten, spontan.“

information:
Misteria is a multidisciplinary event that brings together fashion designers, musicians, artists, and performers in a mystical atmosphere. The theme of the event is Mystery, and each artist will present their own interpretation of it throughout the evening. This secret—what they carry within their unique existence—will unfold in unexpected ways. We aim to create from the unknown, embracing the uncertainty of what may emerge. Misteria is more than just an event; it’s a catalyst for innovation.

On October 25th, at Studio DB, we invite artists to push boundaries, spark new connections, and explore creativity without limits. The evening will feature exhibitions, live performances, and an after-party to extend the magical experience. We encourage guests to step into the unknown and join us on a collective journey of discovery.

lineup: Cristine Brache & Sigrid Lauren, Damsel Elysium, Alice Z Jones , slimgirl fat
information:
The popular maxim “see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil” doesn’t have a universal meaning. In some languages the expression denotes choosing to ignore the harmful actions of another, in others it warns against doing the wrong thing yourself. 3hd’s “See No Evil” evening of performances at HAU Hebbel am Ufer, not only explores these differing-though-related interpretations of social agency and responsibility, but also its definition in relation to existing norms and conventions.

Perspective, interpretation, and projection are some of the psychological themes that haunt the work of Cristine Brache and Sigrid Lauren’s “Goodnight Sweet Thing.” The forty-minute live performance art piece unfolds over three Acts, beginning with a deconstructed Jello wrestling match between protagonists Mary Magdalene and Nothing Girl—two parts of the same mind in literal and psychic conflict—before the scene transforms into a Victorian psychoanalysis session and then crescendos with a 1950s American prom motif. Adapted from Brache's poetry collection of the same name, the performance intertwines poetry, movement, and a score by Ryan Woodhall, to explore the internal battle for authenticity, and examines its complex relationship with societal pressures and authority.

While “Goodnight Sweet Thing” reflects on the complexities of masking and societal performance via overlapping historical time periods, customs, and traditions, Damsel Elysium envisions an alternative world altogether. The multi-instrumentalist, composer, and interdisciplinary artist creates an expressive realm outside language. Damsel draws on their recent Whispers From Ancient Vessels release on AD 93 to enact a collection of tales and “speakings” in immersive live performances that unite sound, plants, and ritual. Their raw and organic soundscapes combine ethereal whispers with the rumbling resonance of their double bass, piano, and field recordings to evoke the voices of nature itself, speaking to its "beautiful evil" by engaging with the earth in all its sublime complexity.

Running for over two evenings, the “See No Evil” double-bill will include a one-hour intermission and afterparty with DJ sets by slimgirl fat playing the Friday, and Alice Z Jones on Saturday.

information:
Berlins größte Halloweenparty
Die Dancefloors verwandeln sich an diesem Wochenende mit Liebe zum Detail in ein Gruselparadies auf allen Ebenen. Ob Hexe, Vampir, Skelett oder angsteinflößender Clown, jeder findet hier seinen Platz. Am Freitag sorgen die Soda-Resident DJs für die beste Partystimmung im spukhaften SODA und der Crossover Floor im Kesselhaus bietet neben dem Maschinenhaus die perfekte Grusel-Partylocation.

Die Maskenbildner von HASSO VON HUGO werden euch kostenlos, professionell und schaurig schön schminken.

Ein, zwei… kommt in der Kulturbrauerei vorbei – drei, vier… es gibt hier reichlich Bier – fünf, sechs… danach wollt ihr nicht weg – sieben, acht… wir feiern die ganze Nacht – neu, zehn… und ihr werdet sicher lange nicht schlafen geh`n!

event_name: MILK ME presents: Public Display Of Affection - Expressions Of Obsessions
lineup: Public Display Of Affection , Lemongrab
information:
Public Display of Affection, MILK ME & Powerline are pleased to present the Berlin Record at Neue Zukunft, In support of the band's new Double Album “Expressions of Obsessions” set for release on the 20th of September.

𝙋𝙪𝙗𝙡𝙞𝙘 𝘿𝙞𝙨𝙥𝙡𝙖𝙮 𝙊𝙛 𝘼𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣
An international band of art punk, provocative indie music. Renowned for their live raucous shows, cinematic visual art & a wild arrangement of styles.
Explosive femme vocals with lyricist & dancer Madeleine Rose, tracks co-produced by Anton Remy, drummer and multi-instrumentalist. Their upcoming Double Album 'Expressions Of Obsessions’ was recorded with both new collaborators and previous members of P.D.O.A.

Playing their part in keeping Germany’s capital weird, P.D.O.A.’s live shows hark back to the fearless eccentricity explored by the West Berlin performance art and music collectives of the 1980’s. P.D.O.A. is an act of near zen-like non duality, hittin’ that golden ratio between the soulful and the sinful.

𝙇𝙚𝙢𝙤𝙣𝙜𝙧𝙖𝙗
Originally hailing from Montreal, core duo Léonie Dishaw and Gaëlle Cordeau relocated to Berlin in 2019, and with the move came a fresh start for Lemongrab. Locking in the drummer of Leipzig synth-punks Lassie, Teun Verheij, along with Fritz Ali Hansen on bass and Joel Thomas on guitar, the band has made a quick yet lasting impression in the Berlin and German punk scenes. Fans of Devo, The Raincoats, Wire, and Delta 5 will love this.

+ 𝙈𝙄𝙇𝙆 𝙈𝙀 𝘿𝙟'𝙨

lineup: Monty & Forbidden Kitty
information:
The Venus KickOff Party
INSOMNIA Berlin @ VENUS 2024
Trade fair stand from 11 a.m. with various acts and workshops
Melodic Techno, Techno & Electro by DJs Monty & Forbidden Kitty
Kinky Midnight Show “Vikings” by Brittany Bardot
BDSM playgrounds - whirlpool - couples area
Advance tickets are available on our website or at the INSOMNIA cloakroom. 

INSOMNIA is THE sex-positive hotspot and safe space for hedonists, sexual free spirits, BDSM and fetish lovers, and the queer community.

At Venus 2024, we will once again be presenting ourselves with our own booth, the INSOMNIA Lounge, kinky shows and extraordinary party nights in the club after the fair.

Together with Joyclub Sex Education, we are once again setting a few feminist accents this year against the male-dominated program at the fair – sex coaches and modern sex-positive relationship therapists invite you to lectures and stimulating discussions in our INSOMNIA Lounge in Hall 18. But of course the shows won't be neglected either.

At our booth at the Venus trade fair, you can not only have a friendly chat with Dominique and other personalities from INSONIA, but you can also have yourself professionally photographed with your favorite star or starlet by our in-house photographer in a photo corner. A sex coaching area, where tantra specialists and sex therapists inform you about sexual wellness and alternative forms of love and relationships, completes our exciting ensemble.

Every half hour, you can listen to interesting lectures while enjoying a relaxing drink at the specially designed INSOMNIA bar.

Enjoy the days with us at Venus and when the gates close under the radio tower, we will roll out the red carpet at INSOMNIA for international guests and, of course, stars and starlets from the scene.

On Friday, October 25th, from 10:00 p.m., we look forward to the “Venus Kick Off” party with DJs Monty & Forbidden Kitten and driving techno beats. A breathtakingly indecent show “Vikings” by the enchanting Brittany Bardot awaits you around midnight.

On Saturday, October 26th, from 10 p.m., “Venus Bizarre” will follow – the fetish party and sex-positive hotspot for all night owls. Here you can let yourself go after the day at the fair, try out the newly purchased fetish outfit, dance to the electronic beats of our techno-house-psytrance DJs Anubix & DonDilone and be enchanted by a particularly obscene performance by DoubleTrouble Berlin.

In addition to the party activities, our BDSM catacombs in the basement, the separate playrooms, couple area, clinic area, massage and whirlpool invite you to indulge in forbidden games and sinful activities.

Our attentive awareness team will take care of you and your safe space and is always approachable.

Admission on Friday or Saturday:
€30 per person, €27 in advance 

Combined ticket for Friday and Saturday:
55€ per person, 50€ presale 

Tickets are also available at the box office at the club or at the INSOMNIA stand at the Venus trade show. It is recommended that you purchase tickets in advance.


Rules of the evening:

Our awareness team will be in the club and is always available to talk to.

No means no.

Do you want to talk to someone, dance or play? Ask politely if they are interested and respect their answer.

Leave others their space when they are playing with each other or being intimate. Do you want to join in? Ask politely and respect their answer.

- Cell phones are not allowed! Leave them in the dressing room.

- Crossing boundaries will not be tolerated. Ask, a no is a no.

Sexual or verbal harassment will not be tolerated under any circumstances.

lineup: Projektbau, Montee, Misha Biork, Dom Hyuga
information:
Toska - noun /ˈtō-skə/ - a feeling of sadness and melancholia without any specific cause.

After years of releasing songs inspired by the anxious & melancholic side of club culture, Projektbau launches international event-series TOSKA to bring his sound of restlessness to intimate venues around the globe.

Inspired by the ethos of emo and punk shows, TOSKA aims to bring back a sense of community and emotional depth that has been lost in the rapid commercialisation of dance music. 

Expect a unique lineup of selectors with a wide sonic palette spanning only the best House, UK Garage, Breakbeat and Trance tunes.

Real Music. Real Emotions.

LINEUP

Projektbau
Montee
Misha Biork
Dom Hyuga

23:00 - 05:00

--


"No single word in English renders all the shades of TOSKA. At its deepest and most painful, it is a sensation of great spiritual anguish, often without any specific cause. At less morbid levels it is a dull ache of the soul, a longing with nothing to long for, a sick pining, a vague restlessness, mental throes, yearning. In particular cases it may be the desire for somebody of something specific, nostalgia, love-sickness. At the lowest level it grades into ennui, boredom.” - Vladimir Nabokov

lineup: Berghain:, Sorcery (live), abs8lute, Beste Hira, DVS1, Fadi Mohem, Fiedel, Grace Dahl , Temudo, , Panorama Bar: , Francesco Del Garda, Jana Falcon, Justin Strauss, Mandel, PARAMIDA, Richard Akingbehin, Robert Owens, Steffi, , SÄULE:, L.B. Dub Corp (live) (Luke Slater)
information:
Man kann ihn ohne Übertreibung als die Stimme der House-Musik bezeichnen, die auch diejenigen sofort erkennen, die sich nur gelegentlich in der Nähe eines Dancefloors aufgehalten haben: Robert Owens. Seine Chicago-House-Torch-Songs "Bring Down The Walls" und "Can You Feel It", die er in der zweiten Hälfte der 80er Jahre zusammen mit Larry Heard aufnahm, oder das 1991 mit Satoshi Tomiie entstandene "I'll Be Your Friend" machten ihn für immer zur Legende. Seitdem hat Owens seine charismatische Stimme auf unzähligen Platten von Künstlern wie Masters At Work, Photek oder zuletzt Luke Slater und seinem Projekt L.B. Dub Corp. erklingen lassen. Robert Owens legt zur heutigen Klubnacht in der Panorama Bar auf, Slater spielt mit seinem House-Projekt live in der Säule. Berghain-Premiere für Grace Dahl, DJ, Produzentin und Labelbetreiberin (Serial Disc Touchers) mit finnisch-ungarischen Wurzeln. Als Resident-DJ der Vault Sessions ist sie für ihre vielseitigen Techno-Sets, treibenden Grooves und kraftvollen Kickdrums bekannt. Mandel, der auf Refuge Worldwide eine eigene Radiosendung namens House of Highlife hat, legt ebenfalls zum ersten Mal bei uns auf.

It's no overstatement to call him the voice of house music, instantly recognizable to anyone who's ever been remotely near a dancefloor: Robert Owens. His Chicago house-torch songs “Bring Down The Walls” and “Can You Feel It”, recorded with Larry Heard in the second half of the 80s, and “I'll Be Your Friend”, which he wrote with Satoshi Tomiie in 1991, made him a legend. Since then, Owens has lent his charismatic voice to countless records by acts such as Masters At Work, Photek and, most recently, Luke Slater and his project LB Dub Corp. Robert Owens will be playing at Panorama Bar for this edition of Klubnacht, and Slater will be playing live in the Säule with his house project. Berghain debut for Grace Dahl, DJ/producer and label owner (Serial Disc Touchers) with Finnish-Hungarian roots. As resident DJ of Vault Sessions, she's known for her versatile techno sets, propulsive grooves and powerful kick drums. Also playing here for the first time is Mandel, who has his own radio show called House of Highlife on Refuge Worldwide.

information:
Horror in the Night: Berlin's Ultimate Halloween Haunt

Datum: 26.10.2024
Ort: M-BIA Club Berlin

Willkommen, mutige Seelen, zur ultimativen Halloween-Nacht im M-BIA Club Berlin, wo das Unheimliche erwacht und die Dunkelheit zum Leben erwacht.

Tretet ein in eine düstere Welt des Psytrance. Unser hypnotischer Sound wird euch in einen tranceartigen Albtraum ziehen, aus dem es kein Erwachen gibt.

Folge dem dunklen Ruf der Techno-Beats mit einem düsteren Soundtrack, der Dich auf eine Reise durch die Schatten mitnimmt, die Deinen Verstand herausfordern wird.

Unserer gruseligen Kulisse und schaurigen Dekorationen werden euch in eine andere Dimension transportieren. Bereitet euch auf das Unerklärliche vor und lasst euch von den unheimlichen Überraschungen verzaubern.

Zieht eure schaurigsten Kostüme an und betretet das M-BIA in Berlin, wenn die Dunkelheit hereinbricht. Seid ihr mutig genug, die Nacht des Horrors zu erleben? Unser Event wird eure schlimmsten Albträume wahr werden lassen. Der Eintritt in den Abgrund kostet nur einen Klick entfernt.

Wenn euer Kostüm unseren Kassendamen beeindruckt, wird sie euch großzügig belohnen. Zeigt eure Kreativität und erhaltet eine besondere Anerkennung für eure Mühe!


■ ■ ■ LOCATION ■ ■ ■

■ Dircksenstraße 123, 10178 Berlin
■ Direkt am S+U Alexanderplatz

promoters: Good Day Berlin Kultur und Veranstaltungen GmbH
lineup: Gallowstreet (INI Movement/NL) *live*
information:
Gallowstreet sind eine Brass Band aus Amsterdam, bestehend aus sieben Bläsern und einem explosiven Schlagzeuger. Ihr Vorhaben: Das Repertoire einer Brass Band mit einer Melange aus Big Band Swing, Hip-Hop Grooves, Disco und House Klängen neu aufzustellen. Gallowstreet nutzen diese breite Palette musikalischer Genres, um mit ihren Kompositionen Geschichten zu erzählen, die meisten davon beatgetrieben, alle von hymnischer Qualität. Ihre Bühnenshows sind phänomenal, denn mit ihrer unerbittlichen Rhythmik erzeugen sie einen Sog, der die Intensität eines erstklassigen DJ-Sets locker erreicht.

Inzwischen ist die Band seit über zehn Jahren mit ihrer avantgardistischen Blechblasmusik unterwegs und hat sich zu einer großen Inspirationsquelle für die junge, aufstrebende europäische Brass Band Szene entwickelt. Es vergeht keine Woche, in der nicht ein Gallowstreet Song von jungen, begeisterten Brass Bands neu arrangiert und gecovert wird.

Mit ihrem jüngsten Album “A Trip Worth Making“ reflektiert die Gallowstreet-Crew ihre gemeinsame Reise und lässt die Herausforderungen, Chancen und Feiern Revue passieren, die sie auf diesem Weg sowohl als Gruppe als auch als einzelne Musiker erlebt haben. Es ist ein Höhepunkt des Sounds, den sie im Laufe der Jahre entwickelt haben, indem sie mitsingbare Hymnen, intelligent orchestrierte Drops und Builds sowie emotionsgeladene Riffs effektiv zu einem Album zusammenfügen, das einige der härtesten Bläsersätze liefert, die die Welt je gehört hat.

Für diese Veranstaltung bieten wir ermäßigte Tickets an, um auch Menschen mit kleinerem Portmonee Zugang zu Kultur zu ermöglichen. Diese Kontingente sind limitiert und nur bei TixforGigs verfügbar. Wir vertrauen auf Eure Selbsteinschätzung: Wenn ihr könnt, bucht Standard-Tickets und überlasst die ermäßigten Kontingente denjenigen, die gerade sehr sparen müssen.

Photo: Delicious Tunes

__________________________________________


Gallowstreet, the Dutch brass band with an attitude. Hailing from the Galgenstraat in Amsterdam they have refined their sound through the course of 4 albums.

A decade of innovating brass music. Gallowstreet has been up and at it. This squad of dedicated musicians from Amster­dam has been proving its worth at festivals and clubs both in the Netherlands and abroad. Armed with 7 horn players and 1 drummer the band employs a wide range of musical genres to tell stories with their compositions, most of them beat driven, all of them with anthemic quality.

Gallowstreet has proven to be a big inspiration for the emerging European Brass Band scene. A reference point for musicians that look to the band for inspiration. There’s no week that goes by without a video of one of the songs being covered by young enthusiastic brass bands from around the globe. Their songs have seen re-arrangements for a wide range of ensembles and Gallowstreet has been a consistent source of inspiration for other bands.  

With “A Trip Worth Making” the Gallowstreet crew reflects on their communal journey and revisits the challenges, oppor­tunities and celebrations they’ve had along the way, both as a group and as individual musicians. It is a culmination of the sound they’ve developed throughout the years, effectively using ready-to-sing along anthems, intelligently orchestrated drops and builds and emotionally laden riffs to build an album that delivers some of the heaviest brass music the world has ever heard. With shows on Lowlands, North Sea Jazz, Bout Du Monde, in Algeria, Slowakia and Turkey and sold out clubshows in the famous Paradiso in Amsterdam and the legendary New Morning in Paris the band is a well-traveled, seasoned ensemble that knows the crack of the whip when it comes to playing big shows for large crowds.

For this event we offer discounted tickets to give people with less money still access to culture. These quotas are limited and only available at TixforGigs. We trust in your self-assessment: If you can, please book standard tickets and leave the reduced tickets to those who have to save money at the moment.

Photo: Delicious Tunes

information:
Chaos comes before all principles of order and entropy. Its foolish desires encompass every choreography; each dance, a performance of chaos. By invoking chaos magick, we call upon ourselves all kinds of forces; those that bring liberation and joy and those that could potentially harm or paralyze us.

If our boundaries aren't firm, we risk giving up too much of our personal power. Like elements called upon when casting a circle, think of your boundaries as the forces you conjure to protect yourself by blocking out unwanted influences.

Recall: When did someone last cross the line with you? 

Define: What are the absolute limits that others can’t cross without consequences?

Assert: Take these boundary definitions and turn them into affirmations.

As a form of reversal magic, this spell moves the energy of the boundary from being dependent on the actions of others to affirming your own principles. It’s not so much about shifting the paradigm as it is about rewiring the paradigm from the inside. The first step is to call all your power back to you. From there, you can explore. To release the mind from habitual thinking, a stimulus may be required.

It is HIGH⛤​​​​​​5.
Let the ceremony begin.

⛤​​​​​​​​​​​​​​ We call upon the element of EARTH to bring stability and resilience.

⛤​​​​​​​​​​​​​​ We call upon the element of WATER to bring fluidity and compassion.

⛤​​​​​​​​​​​​​​ We call upon the element of FIRE to bring transformative energy that creates rather than destroy.

⛤​​​​​​​ We call upon the element of AIR to bring mental clarity and learning.

⛤​​​​​​​​​​​​​​ We call upon the element of SPIRIT in the tarot archetype of the Hierophant, the wise and mighty Mistress who shows us the ancient path that will set us free and protect us from evil forces.

Look around: you're surrounded by potential accomplices, comrades, lovers, maenads, sorceresses. Dare to glimpse new routes and states of existence. Experiment with choices and (per)versions of yourself you'd never thought possible. Wear some make-up (and not much more). Perceive and perform your power, share and submit your power and wisdom, and empower each other in return. 

Come early and stay late.
HIGH⛤5

A part of the proceeds from HIGH⛤5 will go to benefit ONYX & ROSA - A Sex Positive Tarot Film.

Follow us on Telegram for details on the location and more!

The QUEER SKIN exhibition explores themes of identity, body transformation, and rebellion against conventional beauty standards. This event celebrates queer art, fashion, music, and expression, featuring interdisciplinary works from painting and photography to live performances and music acts. Attendees can also join a panel discussion on queer art and visibility before the runway show, which blends fashion, performance, and art in a unique spectacle. The evening concludes with an aftershow party, where queer DJs will set the tone for a night of dancing and celebration.

information:
Mit seiner „& Friends“ Reihe lädt sich Kranich Head-Honcho Robin Schellenberg monatlich befreundete Produzenten & DJs in den *Club „Hinter den Alpen“. Mit je einem Solo-Set und einem anschließenden b2b werden Unterschiede herausgearbeitet und Gemeinsamkeiten gefeiert. Unser Resident Emorine lädt einmal im Monat zu seiner „Wellenbruch“ Reihe und vermisst hier Genre-Grenzen innerhalb der elektronischen Tanzmusik neu – nur um sie dann über den Wellenkamm zu brechen. Heute Abend kommen beide Veranstaltungen zusammen und lassen zwei DJs auf wunderbarste Weise kollidieren. Tanzschuhe einpacken.

Both Producers and DJs, with releases on labels like Stil Vor Talent, Katermukke and Einmusika (Schellenberg) or Frooogs, Magician On Duty and Cold Groove (Emorine) they bring a huge variety of electronic dance music to the decks – for a big dive into this Saturday night.

lineup: Burkhard Beins 60-Sextet, Andrea Neumann – inside piano, Burkhard Beins – percussion, Chris Abrahams – dx7, Josten Myburgh – saxophone, Matt Davis – trumpet, Tizia Zimmermann – accordion, , Trio Sowari, Phil Durrant – modular synth, computer, Bertrand Denzler – tenor saxophone, Burkhard Beins – percussion, objects
information:
The percussionist, electronic musician and bassist Burkhard Beins is celebrating his sixtieth birthday as a constantly reinventing veteran and companion of Berlins Echtzeitmusik. For this occasion, he invites a 60-sextet made up of Berlin scene and international guests, old and new companions, for a very special, collectively improvised birthday concert as part of the series biegungen im ausland.
In his performances, the self-taught musician uses various sound objects and unusual sound generators (small electrics) in addition to the drums. Since the late 1980s he has been playing at international festivals, as well as concerts and tours in Europe and North America. Burkhard Beins has already worked with countless musicians and composers, including Keith Rowe, Sven-Åke Johansson, Peter Niklas Wilson, Orm Finnendahl, John Tilbury, Charlemagne Palestine and Axel Dörner. He is a member of the ensembles Perlonex (with Ignaz Schick), Activity Center (with Michael Renkel), Polwechsel, The Sealed Knot, Phosphor, Trio Sowari, BBB and others.

Trio Sowari brings together three musicians who have developed a very personal approach to their instrument. Respectively based in London, Paris and Berlin, Phil Durrant, Bertrand Denzler and Burkhard Beins never cease to widen the scope of their research at the crossroads of different acoustic and electronic worlds. Beyond the rigour of their improvisations, their music is nourished by multiple influences and the countless collaborations they have with artists from all horizons. Trio Sowari thus becomes a space in perpetual mutation where different currents of experimental music meet and in which asymmetrical concretions are formed, marking out an unpredictable topography. In 2024, Trio Sowari will be celebrating its 20th year of existence. Since 2004, the trio has played at numerous international festivals and venues throughout Europe. The group will release its fourth album to mark the anniversary.

Hello Halloween 2024! 

Am 26.10. wird der cassiopeia Club zur gruseligsten Party-Location Berlins – die legendäre Halloween-Party steht an!  Auf 3 Floors erwartet euch ein höllisch gutes Line-Up:
Pop-Floor: Hier wird es schaurig-schön! Tanz dich durch die Nacht zu den größten Hits, die dir Gänsehaut garantieren. 
Rock-Floor: Lasst die Gitarren heulen und trefft die Monster im Moshpit! Rock, der dich die ganze Nacht lang wachhält. 
Karaoke-Floor: Schreie und singe mit! Schnapp dir das Mikro und lass deine düstere Seite aufblitzen. Wer hat die gruseligste Stimme? 
Und weil Halloween ohne Kostüm einfach lame ist: Wir wollen sehen, wie creepy ihr sein könnt! Ob Vampir, Geist oder Hexe – schmeißt euch in eure wildesten Outfits und schockt uns! 
Macht euch bereit für eine Nacht voller Nervenkitzel, geiler Musik und schaurig-schöner Momente. Der 26.10. wird unvergesslich – wenn ihr euch traut! 

See you on the dark side – im cassiopeia Club!

Die Dancefloors verwandeln sich an diesem Wochenende mit Liebe zum Detail in ein Gruselparadies auf allen Ebenen. Ob Hexe, Vampir, Skelett oder angsteinflößender Clown, jeder findet hier seinen Platz. Am Samstag sorgen die Soda-Resident DJs für die beste Partystimmung im spukhaften SODA. Der Crossover Floor im Kesselhaus haut euch zusätzlich aus den Socken und bietet neben dem Maschinenhaus und der Alten Kantine die perfekte Grusel-Partylocation. Die Maskenbildner von HASSO VON HUGO werden euch an beiden Tagen kostenlos, professionell und schaurig schön schminken.

Advance tickets at the INSOMNIA cloakroom and on our website. 

The INSOMNIA is the sex-positive hotspot and safe space for hedonists, sexual free spirits, BDSM and fetish lovers, and the queer community.

At Venus 2024, we will once again be presenting our own stand, the INSOMNIA Lounge, kinky shows and extraordinary party nights in the club after the fair.

Together with Joyclub Sex Education, we are once again setting a few feminist accents this year against the male-dominated program at the fair – sex coaches and modern sex-positive relationship therapists invite you to lectures and stimulating discussions in our INSOMNIA Lounge in Hall 18. But of course the shows won't be neglected either.

At our booth at the Venus trade fair, you can not only have a friendly chat with Dominique and other personalities from INSONIA, but you can also have yourself professionally photographed with your favorite star or starlet by our in-house photographer in a photo corner. A sex coaching area, where tantra specialists and sex therapists inform you about sexual wellness and alternative forms of love and relationships, completes our exciting ensemble.

Every half hour, you can listen to interesting lectures while enjoying a relaxing drink at the specially designed INSOMNIA bar.

Enjoy the days with us at Venus and when the gates close under the radio tower, we will roll out the red carpet for international guests and, of course, stars and starlets from the scene at INSOMNIA.

On Saturday, October 26th, the “Venus Bizarre” will follow from 10:00 p.m. – the fetish party and sex-positive hotspot for all night owls. Here you can let yourself go after the day at the fair, try out your newly purchased fetish outfit, dance to the electronic beats of our techno-house-psytrance DJs Anubix & DonDilone and be enchanted by a particularly obscene performance by DoubleTrouble Berlin.

In addition to the party activities, our BDSM catacombs in the basement, the separate playrooms, couple area, clinic area, massage and whirlpool invite you to indulge in forbidden games and sinful activities.

Our attentive awareness team will take care of you and your safe space and is always approachable.

event_name: Hillside with Sara Neidorf & DO U WANT TO MOVE BACK TO LDN
lineup: Sara Neidorf, DO U WANT TO MOVE BACK TO LDN
information:
26.10.2024
Doors: 8:30pm
Start: 9pm
 
Sara Neidorf (they/she) is a Berlin-based drummer and film curator. They drum in the bands Mellowdeath, Aptera, Graien, Mad Kate | The Tide, and Sarattma. Neidorf has worked as a musician in theater and dance contexts, live scoring films, and as a session drummer has toured internationally with such artists as The Brian Jonestown Massacre, Hypnodrone Ensemble, Tau, and Sometimes With Others. She co-directs and curates Final Girls Berlin Film Festival, which screens horror films made by FLINTA* filmmakers. Whether in their music or film work, they're interested in exploring crevices, tensions, transgressions, and the sites where conventions implode upon themselves.
 
DO U WANT TO MOVE BACK TO LDN is a collaborative project between John T. Gast and Solomon Garçon. The project uses experimental techniques borrowed from noise, dub, classical, and film score. Their live performances take an improvisational approach which is echoed in the recorded output available viaDOUWANTTOMOVEBACKTOLDN.COM 
Previous shows include Cafe Oto (UK), Spanners (UK) and IIR Resideny (DK).
 
This show uses strobe lights.
 
This event takes place as part of Hillside.

address: 70 Am Wriezener Bahnhof; Friedrichshain; 10243 Berlin; Germany
lineup: Svetlana Spajić – voice, Andi Stecher – drums, Guido Möbius – feedback, Bass, electronics
information:
Gordan make music between expressivity and abstraction. Their pieces are open processes that create a loss of sense of time. Arrangements reduced to the essentials and expressive singing combine to form a powerful musical whole. Something new emerges from minimalism, intensity and the Balkan singing tradition.

When Gordan's first album “Down In The Meadow” was released on Morphine Records in October 2021, it was celebrated by critics and listeners alike. In May 2024, the trio presented their second, in some respects even more radical album (“Gordan”, Glitterbeat Records). With this release, Gordan reinforces the mystique of legends and stories from the Balkan countries through controlled feedback, hypnotic bass, expressive drumming and the unique singing of Svetlana Spajic.

Gordan’s music is marked by radical reduction, seemingly endless ascension and a passion for experiments. The Serbian singer Svetlana Spajić is an internationally recognized expert on the history and practice of an extremely rich musical tradition. She knows and masters the hyperlocal singing styles of the Balkan Peninsula like no other contemporary singer. Guido Möbius plays bass and various electronic sound generators. He also uses a guitar amplifier, microphone and effects to provoke feedback that harmonizes with or rubs against the vocals. A dialogue between sound and noise, expanded or fragmented by Andi Stecher's expressive drumming. Stecher dispenses with any ornamentation and at the same time plays in a varied and concentrated manner. Together the trio forms a dynamic sound body.

promoters: Good Day Berlin Kultur und Veranstaltungen GmbH
lineup: Sungazer (676832 Records DK2/US) *live, , Sean Steinfeger (Opening DJ-Set/D)
information:
Elektro-Future-Jazz-Explosion

Sungazer, gegründet in Brooklyn New York, besteht aus dem Bassisten und Musik-Youtuber Adam Neely und dem Schlagzeuger Shawn Crowder. Wer ihre letzte Show im Gretchen gesehen hat, weiß: Ihre Konzerte sind eine Explosion aus Fusion-Jazz, 8-Bit, Glitch und Progressive Rock. Sungazer springen in die Lücke zwischen Jazz und Electronica, bringen den Geist der Improvisation in die elektronische Musik und zaubern pure Jazzeuphorie auf die Bühne. Mit ihrer speziellen Mischung arbeiten sie im Grenzbereich zwischen Jazzimprovisation und moderner elektronischer Musikästhetik.

Sungazer gibt’s seit 2014. In der Zwischenzeit waren sie bereits mit Ghost-Note, Shubh Saran und Moon Hooch auf Tournee und sind auf drei Kontinenten aufgetreten. Nach den beiden vielversprechenden EPs “Sungazer Vol.1“ und “Sungazer Vol.2“ veröffentlichten sie 2022 ihre erste LP “Perihelion“. Koproduziert und gemischt von Simon Grove, sowie unter Mitwirkung einer Fülle von Gastmusiker*innen eingespielt, bringen sie hier ihr ästhetisches Programm auf den Punkt. Außerdem tauchen die beiden auf YouTube regelmäßig tief in die Technik ihrer Kunst ein und erreichen mit ihren skurrilen Videoproduktionen ein riesiges Publikum.

Wie Sungazer das Spielerische mit dem Methodischen verbinden und welche glitzernden Klänge sie aus der elektronischen Welt zaubern, lässt sich sehr gut am Beispiel der Tracks 'THICC', 'Drunk' und 'Threshold' nachvollziehen.

Photo: Jeanette D. Moses

_______________________________________


Sungazer is an international Future Jazz duo featuring YouTuber / bassist Adam Neely and drummer Shawn Crowder.

Originally formed in Brooklyn, NY in July of 2014, Sungazer has brought their unique blend of hard-hitting Jazz Fusion, 8-bit and Progressive Rock to audiences in the U.S. and Europe. Sungazer explores the human element of improvisation within the context of modern electronic music. Exciting, hard-hitting, and never predictable, Sungazer creates music aimed squarely ahead into the 21st century. They released their sophomore EP entitled Sungazer, Vol.2 in 2019.

On October 11, 2021 they released their debut full-length album, Perihelion. The long-awaited debut LP explores time and the liminal spaces between jazz improvisation and modern electronic music aesthetics. The album was co-produced and mixed by Simon Grove (Plini, Protest The Hero, Intervals) and features an eclectic cast of guest musicians.

Photo: Jeanette D. Moses

Crunch Tapes presents:

29.10 • Tea Eater (US / feat. Gustaf member) @ Barkett Berlin

Tea Eater is a New York City based indie rock / art punk band led by Tarra Thiessen of Gustaf and Sharkmuffin. Their sound combines catchy hooks with sardonic lyrics about butter, killing your doppelganger, and how the DMV is the worst. Formed in 2022, Tea Eater quickly established themselves through their high-energy live shows and DIY ethos. Since the release of their first single ‘I’m Starting a Podcast’, Tea Eater have shared the stage with Thee Oh Sees, completed a successful residency at Bushwick venue The Broadway, and toured the U.S. East Coast.

Their debut album ‘Obsession’, produced and mixed by Drew Vandenburg (Bambara, Faye Webster, Of Montreal), released in the fall of 2023.

lineup: Secret Line-Up
Open Decks for Vinyl DJs
information:
VINYL ONLY! 

Jeden Dienstag ab 18:00 Uhr. Seit inzwischen mehr als 10 Jahren ist der Dienstag mit "Open Decks & Tischtennis" im Humboldthain Club eine feste Instanz für Nordberliner Bewegungsjunkies. 

Ob die Platten zum Auflegen, die Kellen fürs Tischtennis oder die Ballerinas für den Floor – jeden Dienstag könnt ihr euer Spielzeug mitbringen und vom Wochenende entschlacken. 
Ob Techno, Drum and Bass, Disco oder Mamas Schlagersammlung – jeder Stil ist willkommen und wird vom Publikum abgefeiert. 

Daher bietet der "Open Decks Abend" vielen jungen DJs eine nach wie vor einzigartige Plattform zur Darbietung ihrer Künste und zum Austausch untereinander. 

Zwei Tischtennisplatten, genug Kellen für alle, ein Kickertisch, satter Sound aus den Boxen und nicht zuletzt leckeres Bier vom Fass, tragen dazu bei, dass eine stetig wachsende Zahl an gut gelaunten Menschen den Dienstag im Humboldthain Club zu ihrer Homebase erklärt hat. 

FAQ Frage: Wie läuft das mit dem Auflegen? 
Antwort: Zu Beginn jeder Veranstaltung liegt an der Mainbar eine Liste mit den DJ-Slots für den Abend aus. 

Jeder Slot geht eine halbe Stunde und jeder DJ darf nur einen (seinen) Namen in die Liste eintragen. 
Pro Abend gibt es 20 Slots! 
Es empfiehlt sich also, nicht all zu spät zu kommen, sonst ist die Liste voll.

address: 70 Am Wriezener Bahnhof; Friedrichshain; 10243 Berlin; Germany
lineup: Snow Strippers , evilgiane, Eera (Surf Gang Crew)
information:
The world of Snow Strippers is one of pulsating electronics and crunched-and-crashed sleaze. Ripping the souls from the corpses of electroclash, witch house and trashy pop, the New York duo craft nasty ghosted-out nite jams and full-throttle concerts that are a hauntingly gnarly experience. 

Supporting their 2024 release 𝘕𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵 𝘒𝘪𝘭𝘭𝘢𝘻 𝘝𝘰𝘭. 2 on Surf Gang, they appear with two labelmates. evilgiane’s presence and ethereal production style continue to rise and bleed his influence into mainstream hip hop, with production credits including Kendrick Lamar and Baby Keem, Earl Sweatshirt, Playboi Carti, and A$AP Rocky. Eera has worked with a wide array of artists himself including Babyxsosa, Bladee, Black Kray and 03 Greedo. He released his hazy, gloss debut LP 𝘊𝘢𝘯'𝘵 𝘚𝘵𝘰𝘱 𝘞𝘢𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘛𝘪𝘮𝘦 in 2023.

promoters: Good Day Berlin Kultur und Veranstaltungen GmbH
lineup: The Herbaliser Band (/UK) *live*
information:
Back On Track: The Herbaliser Band

Jazz, Electronica und Funk, zusammengehalten durch ein frisches Hip-Hop Gerüst, dafür steht das Duo The Herbaliser.  Im Januar 1995 veröffentlichten Ollie Teeba und Jake Wherry alias The Herbaliser ihre erste 12"-Single "The Real Killer" beim britischen Label Ninja Tune. Viele werden außerdem ihr im gleichen Jahr erschienenes Debütalbum kennen: "Remedies“ ist eine Mischung aus harten Breaks, Jazz-Samples und Funk und gehört zu den Klassikern der Genreüberschreitung. Bereits ein Jahr später erschien gleich ein zweiter Klassiker: "Blow Your Headphones". Im Zuge der Aufnahmen erweiterten sie ihr Programm um eine achtköpfige Live-Band und verfolgten die Idee, Clubmusik auf Tour zu schicken. Die The Herbaliser Band war geboren und wurde zwei Jahrzehnte lang zu einem festen Bestandteil vieler Elektro-, Dance- und Jazz-Festivals auf der ganzen Welt und war in vielen Clubs zu Hause.

Im Jahr 2020 endete die Zusammenarbeit des ursprünglichen Duos. Jetzt hat sich die Herbaliser Band um Ollie Teeba herum neu aufgestellt und kommt vorbei, um die Alben “Remedies“ und “Blow Your Headphones“ auf die Gretchen-Bühne zu bringen.

Die Besetzung besteht derzeit aus Easy Access AKA Ralph Lamb (Trompete/Flügelhorn), Andrew Ross (Tenor-/Baritonsaxophon), James Morton (Altsaxophon), Micah Moody (Schlagzeug), Patrick Dawes (Perkussion) und Ollie Teeba an den Turntables.

Für diese Veranstaltung bieten wir ermäßigte Tickets an, um auch Menschen mit kleinerem Portmonee Zugang zu Kultur zu ermöglichen. Diese Kontingente sind limitiert und nur bei TixforGigs verfügbar. Wir vertrauen auf Eure Selbsteinschätzung: Wenn ihr könnt, bucht Standard-Tickets und überlasst die ermäßigten Kontingente denjenigen, die gerade sehr sparen müssen.  

_______________________________________


The Herbaliser Band

Way back In January 1995, Ollie Teeba and Jake Wherry AKA The Herbaliser, a
sample-based beatmaking duo from Twickenham, South West London, released their debut 12” single ‘The Real Killer’ on UK label Ninja Tune. The pair were deeply immersed in Hip Hop culture and heavily into digging around in dusty record bins looking for funky samples.
As well as jazz and soul records, they had a particular taste in old movie soundtracks, which would become a particular characteristic of their production sound.
They soon followed up with their first LP, ‘Remedies’ Establishing themselves as one of the main features of the Ninja Tune crew, as they expanded their roster of eclectic artists and DJs. The following year, as they were recording their second full length release, ‘Blow Your Headphones’, they extended their output to include an 8 piece live band and debuted June 1996 at George IV in Brixton. The Herbaliser Band, (which would count among it’s members,
the likes of Easy Access, Chris Bowden and Kaidi Tatham) continued on, touring
internationally, to great reception, from diverse audiences and would become regulars at a multitude of electronic, dance, dub and jazz festivals, worldwide, for the next 2 decades or so.
Finally, in 2020, the relationship, of the production duo that this all began with, came to a conclusion. Yet, in July 2021, when the second pandemic lockdown was in effect, the band performed and recorded a performance for a remote festival in Japan. All bands that year, would perform remotely, if at all.
Now, in 2024, after something of a hiatus, The Herbaliser Band have reformed with a lineup that currently includes Easy Access AKA Ralph Lamb (trumpet/flugelhorn) & Andrew Ross
(tenor/baritone sax-flute), James Morton (alto sax), Micah Moody (drums), Patrick Dawes (percussion) & Ollie Teeba on the turntables.

lineup: Nyokabi Kariũki + The Growth Eternal
information: Nyokabi Kariũki is a Kenyan composer and sound artist. Her spectrum includes classical contemporary and experimental electronic music, pop, film and (East) African traditions, which she is committed to preserving. She performs with piano, voice, electronics and African instruments (kalimbas, mbira, etc.) and is considered a crucial voice in experimental music. // The Growth Eternal is a spiritual bass and vocoder music project. With their sound textures they interweave different genres, turn plants into sound sources and use music as medicine.

lineup: Michael Sebastian, kiskadee
information:
Live Dance musician Michael Sebastian and producer Kiskadee co-headline their debut Berlin show at Salöön. Touring their organic dance music from London, expect Kiasmos meets Fela Kuti.

Michael Sebastian merges contemporary discipline with transcendental spirituality, through jazz improvisation and play. This is framed by an objective to create spaces of collective ecstasy, inspired by his time on a variety of dance-floors. He has just released his EP ‘Move’ featuring incredible collaborators from all disciplines. Featured on New Music Friday South Africa, COLORS, CLASH & Earmilk. 

Kiskadee makes organic electronic music capturing sounds from his surroundings to transform them into uplifting soundscapes that reflect his own experiences. He spent 2023 creating his debut album, first traveling to Iceland to immerse himself in nature and develop the project. A Room for Breathe, released May 2024. Featured on CLASH, Complex & Voices Radio; he has also worked alongside producers such as Andrew Wyatt, Kid Harpoon and Stint; and artists such as James Bay, Liam Gallagher and MIA.

A show you do not want to miss!

lineup: MissVergnügen, The Hans
information:
Hinter dem „letzten Strohhalm des Punk. Besser als Mozart“ steht eine smarte Leichtigkeit: Einmal vom The Hans-Sound gepackt, hat uns ein beschwingter Rock’n’Roll im Griff, der mit dem Punk scharfsinniger, ironischer und genauso humorvoller Texte Hand in Hand geht. 
Schließlich ist The Hans „Iggys rechte Faust“ und „Bowies schwarzes Auge“, wie es eine der wenigen Infos über ihn im Netz, hier das Fever Creek Festival, preisgeben. Doch wer surfend durch die Datensätze auf der Suche nach mehr Infos ist, stößt, in einen direkten Sog geratend, auf seine Songs: Beseelt und bei einem Gitarren-Sound, der schon mit The Kinks oder The Monks verglichen wurde, führt uns The Hans beispielsweise durch „Iggy’s City“ oder schmeißt mit messerscharfem Witz Spekulanten aus Berlin raus – all das nur einen Griff zur E-Gitarre entfernt!

"Was des Tigers täglich Brot (der waghalsige Sprung durch den Feuerreif) ist für The Hans der beherzte Griff zur E-Gitarre. Für so einen Zirkus gibt es wohl keinen besseren Ort als das Eschschloraque. The Hans spielt wohldressierten Punk, charmant und bissig, frei von Tierquälerei und auch textlich immer einen Sprung voraus." (Artist Statement)

Für so ein Konzert gibt es wohl kaum eine bessere Gastgeberin als MissVergnügen. Seit jeher gestaltet sie den Berliner Underground als Musikerin und DJ mit, zuerst in der „selbst-zur-Bar-ernannten“ Garage im Hinterhof des berühmt-berüchtigten Eimer, in der Waffengalerie oder im King-Kong-Klub. Seit 2006 bespielt sie die Mittwochabende im Eschschloraque mit eklektischen Sets und gibt der Subkultur mit DJ-Gästen und Konzerten, wie The Hans, wieder eine Stimme. Ein vergnüglicher Zirkus. Besser als Mozart und Bach zusammen.

lineup: House of Lunacy is an Adult playground for the senses, a sex positive space with consent and comfort at it's principle core. A warren of Art, Theatre and Performances from Berlins most creative souls
information:
Lovers, Dreamers and the Decadent Damned,

Your are cordially invited to the court of the creatures of the night…

The darker months will have fallen upon us and with it we are shrouded in a hazy mist. This can only mean one thing, Halloween is near and the veil is at its thinnest…

There is a place that exists within a realm we can only reach once a year, a place where the beautiful the damned and the delicious dance amongst ageless creatures.

Who’s ready to step through the veil and into a world of temptation and satisfaction. Adorn yourself with your finest robes and taste the blood on your lips as we haunt these walls with immortal souls. 

Take a bite. We are delicious.

House of Lunacy - Dark Versailles The Vampire Ball
31.10.2024
Renate


This is the last House of Lunacy of 2024 and will begin our countdown of the final year of House of Lunacy. You don't want to miss it. 

House of Lunacy is a Lovers Labyrinth set over all floors of Renate. Get lost and find yourself, and explore our installations, our live art, performances and dance to the early hours with our carefully curated DJs and music. 

Costumes are essential. 

ENTRY : We are a LGBTQ+ space and we do not tolerate any forms of discrimination or Homophobia. 

House of Lunacy has a strict dress code and door policy. Each event is created with a creative theme in mind for guests to explore with their clothes, costumes and bodies. 

This is not negotiable and we expect all who jump into this world to join in. This is to enhance everyones experience and to truly create a new adventurous world of love and freedom. 

✵ DRESS CODE ✵ 
Our world is only reachable when in costume. Dark Versailles, Baroque, Renaissance, Vampires, Ballgowns, Powder wigs, decadent pearls and jewels, over the top kink and fetish, divine creatures, dandies, jesters, strumpets and demons.  

GUIDELINES 
✵ HOUSE RULES✵

Unfortunately nobody can ever guarantee a space is 100% safe, but we are striving for perfection. 

No means no. Yes can always become No. 

Never take what doesn't want to be taken and don't give what is not wanted.

Consent is not negotiable. 

We take this very seriously. 

We DO NOT tolerate any form of discrimination, Racism, homophobia, anti trans or hate speech. 

Respect. Respect. Respect. 

Anyone who is found to be disobeying these rules, you will be leaving immediately and dealt with accordingly. 

We will have our care team and Awareness team walking around The House at all times. 

A hand-picked selection of caring and loving souls and party veterans who know how to look out for you and are there to help with whatever the situation. 

Any member of staff (incl bar staff) can be spoken to at any time, they are all connected via walkie talkie to security and the door. 

Never feel embarrassed about asking and talking to them. 

Take care of one and other and always reach out if needed. Find us over in our new Luniverse - 

*Please note RA tickets does not guarantee entry. You have to comply to The House and Renate's rules and door policy.

**NO REFUNDS FOR NO COSTUME **
